partitio: <entryFree id="n33977" type="main" key="parti_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. partio</etym>, <sense id="n33977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sharing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partition; a division</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distribution.</hi> </sense><sense id="n33977.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: si quā in re discrepavit ab <pb n="1309" /> <cb n="PART" /> Antonii divisione nostra partitio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:30:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequabilis praedae partitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:24:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 24, 54</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp.,</quote> <trans><tr>the division of an inheritance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:20:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 20, 50</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">partitionem artium facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl>: nec partitione minuitur, Aug. Civ. Dei, 10, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n33977.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n33977.3" n="A" level="2"> In philos. lang., <hi rend="ital">a logical division into parts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">members</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a partition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">definitiones aliae sunt partitionum, aliae divisionum: partitionum, cum res ea, quae proposita est, quasi in membra discerpitur ... divisionum autem definitio formas omnes complectitur, quae sub eo genere sunt, quod definitur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:5:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 5, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: in partitione quasi membra sunt: ut corporis caput, umeri, manus, latera, crura, pedes et cetera: in divisione formae sunt, quas Graeci <foreign lang="greek">i)de/as</foreign> vocant: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri, si qui haec forte tractant, species appellant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 1</bibl> sqq.; 15, 10, 63; 7, 1, 1.—</sense><sense id="n33977.4" n="B" level="2"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a rhetorical division into parts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">heads</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a partition</hi>, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">diai/resis</foreign>; also used as <hi rend="ital">a title of rhetorical treatises</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte habita in causā partitio illustrem et perspicuam totam efficit orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:22:31 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 22, 31 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 13</bibl>.—So the title of Cicero's treatise De Partitione Oratoriā.</sense></entryFree>
partito: <entryFree id="n33978" type="main" key="parti_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partītō</orth>, v. 2. partio, <sense id="n33978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Part. perf. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
partitor: <entryFree id="n33979" type="main" key="parti_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>partior</etym>, <sense id="n33979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a divider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distributer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum te partitorem ad partiendas merces missum putares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 5, 12</bibl></cit> dub. (al. portitorem); cf. partitor, <foreign lang="greek">meristh/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
partitudo: <entryFree id="n33980" type="main" key="parti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pario</etym>, <sense id="n33980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bringing forth</hi> young, <hi rend="ital">parturition</hi> (ante-and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propinqua partitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 9</bibl> (both passages cited ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 28</bibl> and 30); Cod. Th. 9, 42, 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
partitus: <entryFree id="n33981" type="main" key="parti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. partio.</entryFree>
partor: <entryFree id="n33982" type="main" key="partor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, v. postpartor.</entryFree>
partualis: <entryFree id="n33983" type="main" key="partu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. partus</etym>, <sense id="n33983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to bearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">birth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
partula: <entryFree id="n33984" type="main" key="Partu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Partŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n33984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess who presides over birth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
partura: <entryFree id="n33985" type="hapax" key="partu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. pario</etym>, <sense id="n33985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 26</bibl> (al. paritura).</sense></entryFree>
parturibundus: <entryFree id="n33986" type="main" key="partu^ri^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partŭrĭbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>parturio</etym>, <sense id="n33986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in travail</hi>, De Miracc. S. Steph. 2, 2, 2.</sense></entryFree>
parturio: <entryFree id="n33987" type="main" key="partu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, 4</itype> (<sense id="n33987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> parturibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 21, 1</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. desid. a.</hi> [2. pario], <hi rend="ital">to desire to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in travail</hi> or <hi rend="ital">labor;</hi> said of women and of animals. </sense><sense id="n33987.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor ne parturire intellegat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu (Lucina) voto parturientis ades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:256" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parturiens canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: parturiunt montes, nascetur ridiculus mus, said of those who promise great things, but accomplish little or nothing; <cit><quote lang="la">like the Engl. expression,</quote> <trans><tr>great cry and little wool</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 139</bibl></cit> (after the Greek proverb, <foreign lang="greek">w)/dinen o)/ros, ei)=ta mu=n a)pe/teken</foreign>); cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, also,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:21:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 21, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n33987.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33987.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be big</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pregnant with</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to brood over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meditate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 39, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aliquando dolor populi Romani pariat, quod jamdiu parturit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:46:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 46, 118</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quod diu parturit animus vester, aliquando pariat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 18, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentes parturit ira minas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 208</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">filioli mei quos iterum parturio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n33987.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be anxious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concerned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā (securitate) frui non possit animus, si tamquam parturiat unus pro pluribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33987.5" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generate</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quis Parthum paveat ... Quis Germania quos horrida parturit Fetus, incolumi Caesare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nunc omnis ager, nunc omnis parturit arbos,</quote> <trans><tr>is budding forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 330</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Col. poët. 10, 10: neque parturit imbres Perpetuos (Notus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: felicemque uterum, qui nomina parturit annis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the yearly consuls</hi>, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 204: <cit><quote lang="la">parturit innumeros angusto pectore mundos,</quote> <trans><tr>to conceive</tr>, <tr>imagine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 81, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">partŭrĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a woman in labor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores parturientis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Osee, 13, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 47, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parturitio: <entryFree id="n33988" type="main" key="partu^ri_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partŭrītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>parturio</etym>, <sense id="n33988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a desiring to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">travail</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n33988.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1</bibl>, n. 22.—</sense><sense id="n33988.2" n="II" level="1"> <cb n="PARU" /> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bringing forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parturition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novae vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cordis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 34</bibl></cit> (al. 31).—</sense><sense id="n33988.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Any grievous pains</hi>: inferni, Capreol. Epist. ad Vital. et Const.</sense></entryFree>
partus: <entryFree id="n33989" type="main" key="partus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 2. pario.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33990" type="main" key="partus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n33990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> parti, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 486, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">dat. sing.</hi> partu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 30</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> partibus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, 33</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. pario</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bringing forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">birth</hi> (equally common in the <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n33990.1" n="I" level="1"> In abstr.: propinquitas parti, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 486, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset gravida Auria, et jam appropinquare partus putaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 11, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 673</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam veniret partus ejus, peperit,</quote> <trans><tr>the time for bearing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:66:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 66, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana adhibetur ad partus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturos aperire partus Lenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partūs discrimen subire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:592" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 592</bibl></cit>: (Dejanira) Oenei partu edita, <hi rend="ital">begotten</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 8, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33990.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Graeciae quidem oratorum partus atque fontes vides,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>beginnings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33990.3" n="II" level="1"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">the young</hi> or <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi> of any creature, <hi rend="ital">the fœtus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">embryo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae pro suo partu propugnant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneri partus suus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partus Missos ad Orcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti partus equae constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:626" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 626</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum ferre,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be pregnant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 112</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">partum gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 47, 72, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum eniti,</quote> <trans><tr>to bear</tr>, <tr>bring forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 3, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 3, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 12, 15, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum abigere,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause abortion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 18, 22, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum eicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 6, 20, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum mortuum pellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 21, 26, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 8, 30, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partus gravidarum extorquere tormentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—Leg. maxim: <cit><quote lang="la">partus sequitur ventrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:78" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 5, 9</bibl>. —Of plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33990.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque concipere aut edere partum mens potest, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n33991" type="gloss" key="partus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">partus</orth>, <sense id="n33991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, from pars, v. pars <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
parum: <entryFree id="n33992" type="greek" key="pa^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părum</orth>, <sense id="n33992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst. indecl.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> (for the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> mĭnus and mĭnĭme are used; v. h. vv. sub parvus) [akin to parvus and <foreign lang="greek">pau=ros</foreign>: cf. parco], <hi rend="ital">too little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not enough</hi> (opp. satis and nimium). </sense><sense id="n33992.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n33992.2" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n33992.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac enim satis erat copiae, in illā autem leporis parum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:240" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non parum humanitatis (= satis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis eloquentiae, sapientiae parum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latini sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33992.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis offendit nimium quam parum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 22, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc genere nimium quod est offendit vementius quam id, quod videtur parum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 53, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius est parum cum timore Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 15, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n33992.5" n="B" level="2"> Adverb. </sense><sense id="n33992.6" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum praedicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulitis parum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum procedit quod ago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si parum intellexti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaero ex te, quae parum accepi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum parum memineris, quod concesseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:47:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 47, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affirmatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33992.7" n="b" level="4"> Parum est, videtur, etc., <hi rend="ital">it is</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seems</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not enough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not sufficient</hi>: parum habere, <hi rend="ital">to deem it not enough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be not content</hi> with any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">immo duas dabo, una si parum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus servandis centuplex murus parum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parumne est, quod nobis succenset senex, Ni instigemus etiam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parumne est, quod tantum homines fefellisti, ut neglegeres auctoritatem senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 14, 32</bibl></cit>; often followed by <hi rend="ital">nisi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules parum sībi videri praefati pro merito eorum suā voce conlaudari eos, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum fuisse non laudari Africanum ... nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 54, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 40, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 4, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">38, 54, 9: parum est, ut in curiam venias, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:60" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 60</bibl></cit>; rarely by <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum est, si in partem ejus venis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceu parum sit in tantam pervenire altitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: non nocuisse parum est; <cit><quote lang="la">prodest quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:415" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid satis est, si Roma parum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec talia facinora impune suscepisse parum habuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 9</bibl></cit>: templum violare parum habuisse,<cb n="PARV" />  nisi, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:76" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> parum est, aegrum non esse, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 23</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n33992.8" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">adjectives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not sufficiently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">too little.</hi> sunt ea quidem parum firma, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si parum multi sunt, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum multae necessitudines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 30, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">blanda es parum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: dum pudet te parum optimatem esse, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 9</bibl>, A, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">parum claris lucem dare coget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 12, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33992.9" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">adverbs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo parum diu vixit, qui, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>not enough</tr>, <tr>not sufficiently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mature,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui rei parum diligenter ab iis erat provisum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando dictum est: est autem dictum non parum saepe,</quote> <trans><tr>often enough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum non parum liberaliter domum suam homines invitaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">parum in tempore,</quote> <trans><tr>not in good season</tr>, <tr>too late</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33992.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">not particularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not very</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi> (perh. only postAug.), v. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:781 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 781 sq.</bibl>; Dietsch ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 31</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n33992.11" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">adjectives</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper fuerunt non parum multi, qui, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>not few</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">scripsit non parum multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n33992.12" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sunt composita mea verba: parum id facio,</quote> <trans><tr>I care little for it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 31</bibl></cit> Kritz (but the true read. is parvi, Dietsch ad loc.; Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:page=781" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. p. 781</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">dolebimus, sed parum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 116:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 116, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil aut certe parum, intererat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:20:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(littera M) etiamsi scribitur, tamen parum exprimitur,</quote> <trans><tr>it is hardly sounded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:5" default="NO">8, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessa ipso transitu Vicetia: quod per se parum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non principatus appetens, parum effugerat ne dignus crederetur (= vix),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 39</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 41</bibl>, the better read. is: qui pauca metuit, Bait.).</sense></entryFree>
parumper: <entryFree id="n33993" type="main" key="pa^rumper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">părumper</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, with ref. to time, <sense id="n33993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">for a little while</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for a short time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a while</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a moment</hi>: parumper significat paulisper, quasi perparvum, i. e. valde parvum; <cit><quote lang="la">refertur autem ad tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=221" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 221</bibl></cit> Müll. (class.). </sense><sense id="n33993.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tace parumper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mane dum parumper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum Crassus dixisset, parumper et ipse conticuit et ceteris silentium fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:35:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 35, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discedo parumper a somniis, ad quae mox revertar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 23, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abduco parumper animum a molestiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dent operam parumper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:1" default="NO">2, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsusque parumper Corde dolor tristi,</quote> <trans><tr>a while</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oro parumper Attendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:250" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 250</bibl></cit>.—Defined by <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum exeo, parumper opperire hic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 8, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctatus parumper, dum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n33993.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in a short time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): hinc campos celeri passu permensa parumper Coicit in silvam sese, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 378, 20</bibl> (Ann. v. 74 Vahl.): cito et velociter, Non. (Ann. v. 74 Vahl.); Enn. ap. Non. l. l.; <cit><quote lang="la">378, 17: divi, hoc audite parumper,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 150, 7</bibl></cit> (Ann. v. 214 Vahl.); id. ap. Fest. s. v. solum, p. 301 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
parunculus: <entryFree id="n33994" type="hapax" key="pa^runcu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păruncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>3. paro</etym>, <sense id="n33994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small boat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little bark</hi>, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parus: <entryFree id="n33995" type="main" key="pa_rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pārus</orth> <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n33995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a titmouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tomtit</hi>, Auct. Carm. Phil. 9.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n33996" type="main" key="Pa^rus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Părus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Paros.</entryFree>
parve: <entryFree id="n33997" type="main" key="parve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. parvus <sense id="n33997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
parvibibulus: <entryFree id="n33998" type="hapax" key="parvi^bi^bu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parvĭbĭbŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>parvusbibo</etym>, <sense id="n33998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that drinks little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">phrenetici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:15" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parvicollis: <entryFree id="n33999" type="hapax" key="parvi^collis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parvĭcollis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>parvus-collum</etym>, <sense id="n33999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">short-necked</hi>, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mikrotra/xhlos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
parvifacio: <entryFree id="n34000" type="main" key="parvi^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parvĭ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>facĕre</itype> <etym>parvus</etym>, <sense id="n34000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make light of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to despise</hi> (as one word only anteclass.): parvifaciatur, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 789</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
parvipendo: <entryFree id="n34001" type="main" key="parvi^pendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parvĭpendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, more correctly written separate</itype>, parvi pendo.</entryFree>
parvitas: <entryFree id="n34002" type="main" key="parvi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>parvus</etym>, <sense id="n34002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">smallness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">littleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insignificance</hi> (rare but class.): vincula talia quae cerni non possent propter parvitatem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:13:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 13, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 11, 8, § 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvitates et magnitudines rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:28" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:17:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: mea parvitas ad favorem tuum <pb n="1310" /> <cb n="PARV" /> decurrit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">my humble self</hi>, Val. Max. praef.</sense></entryFree>
parvulum: <entryFree id="n34003" type="main" key="parvu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parvŭlum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. parvulus <sense id="n34003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
parvulus: <entryFree id="n34004" type="main" key="parvu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parvŭlus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">parvŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n34004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [parvus], <hi rend="ital">very small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slight</hi>, (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne dum parvulum hoc consequimur, illud amittamus, quod maximum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvola magni formica laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvula, pumilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulsio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuta et parvola laudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <trans><tr>a skirmish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrimentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 193</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34004.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n34004.2" n="A" level="2"> Of age, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young</hi>: a parvulo, <hi rend="ital">from his childhood</hi>, = a puero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvula (soror),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segmentatis dormisset parvula cunis,</quote> <trans><tr>when a child</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:89" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: ab parvulis, <hi rend="ital">from their infancy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">childhood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a parvulā aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—Esp. as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">parvŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a child</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis mihi parvulus aulā luderet Aeneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 328</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rex Si vis tu fieri, nullus tibi parvolus aulā Luserit Aeneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvulus enim natus est nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exceptis parvulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:14:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 14, 24</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">(ursi) parvuli excepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 28, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34004.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Too little</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not equal to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not sufficient for</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quam illi rei ego etiam nunc sum parvolus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34004.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Deficient in understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscreet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 43</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">parvŭlum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not much</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">aut nihil aut parvulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:18:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 18, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvulum referret, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
parvus: <entryFree id="n34005" type="main" key="parvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">parvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (usual, irreg. <sense id="n34005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: mĭnor, mĭnĭmus.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volantum parviores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:26" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: rictus parvissimus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 456, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvissima corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 615</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:621" default="NO" valid="yes">621</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:199" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 199</bibl>: minerrimus pro minimo dixerunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=122" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 122</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">minimissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5</bibl></cit>, n. 8) [kindr. with paucus and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pau=ros</foreign>; cf., also, parum, parcus], <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderable</hi> (cf.: exiguus, minutus, brevis; in class. prose parvus is not used, like brevis, of stature, v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 33, 45</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n34005.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Posit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in parvis aut mediocribus rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:20:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 20, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam parva sit terra, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 16, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda parva ac mediocria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in parvum quendam et angustum locum concludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium non parvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi pisciculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec parva et infirma sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si parva licet componere magnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 178</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">liberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 21, 37</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of children: salutaria appetant parvi,</quote> <trans><tr>the little ones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva soror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">memini quae plagosum mihi parvo Orbilium dictare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operosa parvus Carmina fingo,</quote> <trans><tr>a little man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a parvis didicimus: si in jus vocat, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>when little</tr>, <tr>in childhood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer in domo a parvo eductus,</quote> <trans><tr>from infancy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Of time, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvae consuetudinis Causa,</quote> <trans><tr>slight</tr>, <tr>short</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in parvo tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 806</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvam fidem habere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic onus horret, Ut parvis animis et parvo corpore majus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo parvo ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvum carmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc opus, hoc studium parvi properemus et ampli,</quote> <trans><tr>both small and great</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>.—With ref. to value or consequence, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">meam erus esse operam deputat parvi pretii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil parvom aut humili modo, Nil mortale loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 25, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et magnis parva mineris Falce recisurum simili te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretio parvo vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi sunt foris arma, nisi est consilium domi,</quote> <trans><tr>of little value</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 22, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi refert abs te jus dici diligenter, nisi, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>it matters little</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:7:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 7, § 20</bibl></cit>.—Hence, parvi facere, aestimare, ducere, pendere, etc., <hi rend="ital">to esteem lightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">care little for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi ego illos facio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvi aestimo, si ego hic peribo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia parvi id duceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: nequam hominis ego parvi <cb n="PARV" /> pendo gratiam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 29</bibl>.—So, in <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa abs te diligenter parvoque curata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quanti emptus? parvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo stat magna potentia nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo contentus esse possum,</quote> <trans><tr>with little</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vivitur parvo bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possim contentus vivere parvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agricolae prisci, fortes parvoque beati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessarium est parvo assuescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123, 3</bibl></cit>: parvo, as an <hi rend="ital">abl. of measure</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> (rarely; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not ante-Aug.): ita ut parvo admodum plures caperentur,</quote> <trans><tr>a very little more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 45, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo brevius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud parvo junior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—So in designating time: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo post,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 42, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo post tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of stature (late Lat. for brevis): <cit><quote lang="la">Zacchaeus staturā parvus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 113:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 113, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 143:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 143, 1</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n34005.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnor</orth>, <itype>us</itype> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">minu/s, minu/qw</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">less</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lesser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smaller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inferior</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in re majore valet, valeat in minore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ea pecunia non minor esset facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:20:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 20, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hibernia dimidio minor quam Britannia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus praedae quam speraverant fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>a smaller quantity</tr>, <tr>less</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sociis dimidio minus quam civibus datum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceus ... si minor (pede), uret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve minor, neu sit quinto productior actu Fabula,</quote> <trans><tr>less than five acts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genibus minor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>down upon his knees</tr>, <tr>on his bended knees</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">minor in certamine longo,</quote> <trans><tr>worsted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numero plures, virtute et honore minores,</quote> <trans><tr>inferior</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 183</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: minor, <hi rend="ital">inferior in rank</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevalidi ad injurias minorum elati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:7:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 7, 49</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens uno minor est Jove,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor capitis, i. e. capiti deminutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 42</bibl></cit>: et sunt notitiā multa minora tuā, <hi rend="ital">too trivial</hi>, = leviora, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:214" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 214</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies sermone minor fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>too short for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infans Et minor igne rogi,</quote> <trans><tr>too young for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:140" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 140</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">abl. of measure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:45:section=117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 45, § 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut uno minus teste haberet?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 57</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">149: bis sex Herculeis ceciderunt, me minus uno, Viribus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>eleven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 554</bibl></cit>.—Of age: <cit><quote lang="la">qui minor est natu,</quote> <trans><tr>younger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquot annis minor natu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetate minor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor uno mense,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia minor Ptolemaei regis,</quote> <trans><tr>the younger daughter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor viginti annis,</quote> <trans><tr>less than twenty years old</tr>, <tr>under twenty years of age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:99:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 99, 1</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor quam viginti quinque annorum natu, Praetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:ib. 50:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 50, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pupilla minor quam viripotens nupserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:ib. 36:2:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 36, 2, 30</bibl></cit>.—So, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: minor, <hi rend="ital">a person under age</hi> (under five-and-twenty), <hi rend="ital">a minor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">De minoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, tit. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">si minor negotiis majoris intervenerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:24" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si minor praetor vel consul jus dixerit, valebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:57" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 42, 1, 57</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">children</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:491" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 491</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">descendants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi>, = posteri: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc fama, minores Italiam dixisse ducis de nomine gentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 532</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 733</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15:47" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:44" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minorum gentium, v. gens.—In specifications of value: vendo meum non pluris quam ceteri, fortasse etiam minoris,</quote> <trans><tr>cheaper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minoris pallium addicere placuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 14</bibl></cit>: omnia minoris aestimare, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fidem suam) non minoris quam publicam ducebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 32, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34005.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">acc. respect.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontemque minor truncam amnis Acarnan,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:42" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:582" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 582</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34005.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto certare minor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu Fatis Superi certare minores!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:76" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n34005.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (whence a new <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimissimus digitorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">166</bibl>; cf., in the Gr., <foreign lang="greek">e)laxisto/tatos</foreign>, from <foreign lang="greek">e)la/xi/stos</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">very small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very little; least</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smallest</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sit nihil omnino in rerum naturā minimum, quod dividi nequeat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimae tenuissimaeque res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minima pars temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā minima altitudo fluminis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in maximā fortunā minima licentia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimus digitulus,</quote> <trans><tr>the little finger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">minimus digitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 103, § 251</bibl></cit>.—Of age: minimus natu horum omnium,<cb n="PARV" />  <hi rend="ital">the youngest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his omnibus natu minimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 38, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hiempsal, qui minimus ex illis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimus filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:5:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—In specifications of value: <cit><quote lang="la">deos minimi facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Quanti emi potest minimo? <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Ad quadraginta fortasse eam posse emi minimo minis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 110</bibl>: Crispinus minimo me provocat, <hi rend="ital">for a trifle</hi> (in a wager), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 14</bibl> (minimo provocare dicuntur hi qui in responsione plus ipsi promittunt quam exigunt ab adversario, Schol.).—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">minima de malis,</quote> <trans><tr>of evils choose the least</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 105</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With a negation emphatically: non minimo discrimine, i. e. maximo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res non minimi periculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil, ne pro minimis quidem, debeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimum firmitatis minimumque virium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimum pedibus itineris confectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde minimum periculi erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 15</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">adv. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia apud me minimum valent,</quote> <trans><tr>very little</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimum distantia miror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dormiebat minimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medica secatur sexies per annos: cum minimum, quater,</quote> <trans><tr>at least</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam minimum credula postero (diei),</quote> <trans><tr>as little as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fiunt omnes partes minimum octoginta et una,</quote> <trans><tr>at least</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (comprehensio) ex tribus minimum partibus constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo non minimum Aetolorum operā regii fugati atque in castra compulsi sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>chiefly</tr>, <tr>particularly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eae omnia novella sata corrumpunt, non minimum vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> </sense><sense id="n34005.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Posit.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">parvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slightly</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34005.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">less</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ne quid faciam plus, quod post me minus fecisse satius sit,</quote> <trans><tr>too little ... too much</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid plus minusve faxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit> (v. plus, under multus): <cit><quote lang="la">cum habeas plus, Pauperiem metuas minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne mea oratio, si minus de aliquo dixero, ingrata: si satis de omnibus, infinita esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 50, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus ipsi per se minus valerent, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 72, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus multi,</quote> <trans><tr>not so many</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus multum et minus bonum vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita imperium semper ad optumum quemque a minus bono transfertur,</quote> <trans><tr>less good</tr>, <tr>not so good</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia Libyes quam Gaetuli minus bellicosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus diu vivunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 141</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus admirabilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:46" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit> Duker: quare milites Metelli sauciabantur multo minus, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 554</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilem admodum inter initia ac paulo minus quam privatum egit,</quote> <trans><tr>little less so than</tr>, <tr>nearly as much so as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidio minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec illa minus aut plus quam tu sapiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus quam aequom erat feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondebo tibi minus fortasse vehementer, quam abs te sum provocatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:30:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 30, 72</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui peccas minus atque ego?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 96</bibl></cit>.—And elliptically, without a particle of comparison: <cit><quote lang="la">minus quindecim dies sunt, quod, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>less than fifteen days</tr>, <tr>not yet fifteen days</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madefactum iri minus XXX. diebus Graeciam sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 32, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus quinquennium est, quod prodiere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cecidere duo milia haud minus peditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum centum et quinquaginta non minus adessent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ex suā cujusque parte ne minus dimidium ad Trebonium perveniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:47:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 47, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut antequam baccae legantur, ne minus triduum serenum fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 38, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34005.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n34005.9" n="a" level="4"> Non (haud) minus quam (atque), <hi rend="ital">not less than</hi>, <hi rend="ital">no less than</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quite as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exanimatus evolat ex senatu, non minus perturbato animo atque vultu, quam si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existumans non minus me tibi quam liberos carum fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non minus nobis jucundi atque illustres sunt ii dies, quibus conservamur quam illi quibus nascimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:20" default="NO">3, 7, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudibus haud minus quam praemio gaudent militum animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud minus ac jussi faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 561</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34005.10" n="b" level="4"> Non (neque) minus, <hi rend="ital">equally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and as well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also</hi>: haec res <pb n="1311" /> <cb n="PASC" /> non minus me male habet quam te, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 30</bibl>: quae hominibus non minus quam liberi cara esse debent, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque minus assiduis fessa choreis,</quote> <trans><tr>also</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34005.11" n="c" level="4"> Nihil minus, in replies, as a strong negation, <hi rend="ital">by no means</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 45</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> At tu apud nos hic mane, Dum redeat ipsa. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Nihil minus, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil profecto minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 81</bibl></cit>;
