cf.: quid? a Tranione servo? <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Multo id minus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 3, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34005.12" n="d" level="4"> Minus minusque, minus et (ac) minus, <hi rend="ital">less and less</hi>: mihi jam minus minusque obtemperat. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam minus atque minus successu laetus equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 616</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus et minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 8, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus ac minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34005.13" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in a softened negation, <hi rend="ital">not at all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by no means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod intellexi minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnumquam ea quae praedicta sunt, minus eveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">si minus: monebo, si quem meministi minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syracusis, si minus supplicio affici, at custodiri oportebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si assecutus sum, gaudeo: sin minus, hoc me tamen consolor quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">minus formido ne exedat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34005.14" n="b" level="4"> Quo minus, also written as one word, quominus, <hi rend="ital">that not</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from</hi>, after verbs of hindering, preventing, as impedio, recuso, deterreo, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te infirmitas valetudinis tenuit, quo minus ad ludos venires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemem credo prohibuisse, quo minus de te certum haberemus, quid ageres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deterrere aliquem, quo minus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 38, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stetisse per Trebonium, quo minus oppido potirentur, videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 16</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. also quo. —Ante-class. also in the reverse order, minus quo: ne vereatur, minus jam quo redeat domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34005.15" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, in two forms, parvissime (post-class.), and minime (class.), <hi rend="ital">least</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very little.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34005.16" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">par-vissĭmē</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">memorare aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>very briefly</tr>, <tr>with very few words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:38" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 38</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34005.17" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭnĭmē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">least of all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the smallest degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">least</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum minime vellem, minimeque opus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum minime videbamur, tum maxime philosophabamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:66:222" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 66, 222</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi placebat Pomponius maxime, vel dicam minime displicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:57:207" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 57, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in miserrimis rebus minime miserum putabis, id facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod minime ad eos mercatores saepe commeant,</quote> <trans><tr>very rarely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 322</bibl>.—Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non decore, at quam minime dedecore facere possimus,</quote> <trans><tr>as little as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 114</bibl></cit>; by <hi rend="ital">omnium</hi> and <hi rend="ital">gentium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad te minime omnium pertinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minime gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus, inquit, puer, arcesse Pamphilam, ... illa exclamat, Minime gentium,</quote> <trans><tr>not for any thing in the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34005.18" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n34005.19" n="a" level="4"> For minimum, saltem, <hi rend="ital">at least</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is morbus erit longissimus minimeque annuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Targ.: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes decem vel minime novem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed id minime bis anno arari debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 16:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 16, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34005.20" n="b" level="4"> In replies, as an emphatic negative, <hi rend="ital">by no means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not at all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not in the least</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 50</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Sed cessas? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Minime equidem: <cit><quote lang="la">nam hodie, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">M.</hi> An tu haec non credis? <hi rend="ital">A.</hi> Minime vero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 10</bibl>: num igitur peccamus? Minime vos quidem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minime, minime hercle vero!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; so in discourse: minime multi (= quam paucissimi). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 2</bibl>: minume irasci decet. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 13</bibl>.—Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">gentium</hi> (cf.supra): <hi rend="ital">Nau.</hi> Meriton' hoc meo videtur factum? <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Minime gentium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pasargadae: <entryFree id="n34006" type="main" key="Pa^sarga^dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Păsargădae</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Persagădae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Parsagăda</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pasarga/dai</foreign>, <sense id="n34006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a citadei in Persis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhabited by the Magi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and containing the tomb of Cyrus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the ruins of Darabgerd.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:116" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 26, 29, § 116</bibl> (al. Frasargida); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pascalis: <entryFree id="n34007" type="main" key="pasca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pascālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for pascualis, from pascuum</etym>, <sense id="n34007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pasturing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grazing</hi>: pascales <cb n="PASC" /> oves Cato posuit pro pascuales, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=243" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 243</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> p. 242: pascali pecore ac montano, Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v. Solox, p. 301 Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">boves pascuales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 4, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pasceolus: <entryFree id="n34008" type="main" key="pasce^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pascĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">fa/skalos, fa/skwlos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n34008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leathern money-bag</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">funda, pera, marsupium): ex alutā sacculus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 151, 10</bibl></cit>: pueri in ludo solent pasceolos furari, Cato ap. Non. l. l. 14; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 13" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum Philippeae minae in pasceolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pascha: <entryFree id="n34009" type="main" key="pascha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pascha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/sxa</foreign> (Hebr. <foreign />). <sense id="n34009.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The feast of the Passover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Easter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollennibus Paschae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege dedit pascham,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Carm. adv. Marc. 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascharum dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:77" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominicum pascha celebrare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 96</bibl></cit>, n. 20: <cit><quote lang="la">post sanctum pascha,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paschate vicino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per tria paschata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Dan. 9, 24</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34009.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The paschal lamb</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 5, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 14, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paschalis: <entryFree id="n34010" type="main" key="pascha_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paschālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pascha</etym>, <sense id="n34010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Passover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to Easter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paschal</hi>: paschale tempus, Cod. Th. 9, 35, 4: dapes, Sedul. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber,</quote> <trans><tr>that treats of the Passover</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 99</bibl></cit>, n. 1.</sense></entryFree>
pascito: <entryFree id="n34011" type="hapax" key="pasci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pascĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>pasco</etym>, <sense id="n34011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pasture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(apes), quae in silvestribus locis pascitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 19</bibl></cit> dub. (al. pastitant).</sense></entryFree>
pasco: <entryFree id="n34012" type="main" key="pasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pasco</orth>, <itype>pāvi, pastum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root pa-; Sanscr. gō-pas, herdsman; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pate/omai</foreign>; cf. pabulum, pastor, Pales, panis; perh. also, Penates, penum</etym>, <sense id="n34012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause to eat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pasture.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34012.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34012.2" n="A" level="2"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">to pasture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive to pasture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend to the feeding of</hi>, etc. (cf. pabulor): <cit><quote lang="la">cum sues puer pasceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges armentaque pavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non, me pascente, capellae, cytisum carpetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpes sub gurgite phocas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pasceret porcos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 15, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34012.3" n="2" level="3"> = depasco, of land, <hi rend="ital">to pasture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give as a pasture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et vomere duros Exercent collis atque horum asperrima pascunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11</bibl></cit>. 319.—</sense><sense id="n34012.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to feed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply with food</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot greges et quantos sit pasturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestias pascere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo (Catone) cum quaereretur, quid maxime in re familiari expediret? respondit: Bene pascere. Quid secundum? Satis bene pascere. Quid tertium? Male pascere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid refert, quantum pascat aut feneret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures calones atque caballi Pascendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 103</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34012.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To feed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nourish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">alo, nutrio): olusculis nos soles pascere,</quote> <trans><tr>used to feed us with vegetables</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos, dives Anagnia, pascis, quos, Amasene pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:684" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 684</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi, ad quos pascendos transmarinarum regionum est optanda fertilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 17:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 17, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">servos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viginti ventres pasco et canem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā provinciarum pascente Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:93" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 93</bibl>.—Of one who gives frequent entertainments, <hi rend="ital">to feast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entertain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plurimos suis sumptibus pasceret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 41</bibl>: se sutoris arte pascere, <hi rend="ital">earn a living</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 8.—Rarely of things: <cit><quote lang="la">et volsis pascunt radicibus herbae (sc. me),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 650</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34012.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cherish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let grow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feed</hi>, etc.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: barbam, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to cherish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let grow</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">pwgwnotrofei=n</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum (Baccho) crinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genas Phoebo, crinem Iaccho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:493" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Danaas paverunt Pergama flammas,</quote> <trans><tr>fed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Taurica dira Caede pharetratae pascitur ara deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polus dum sidera pascet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 608</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 258</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra pascens sata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 12, 18, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitate crassitudinem pascens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <trans><tr>to till</tr>, <tr>cultivate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:58:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 58, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummos alienos,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep adding to</tr>, <tr>heap debt on debt</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34012.7" n="4" level="3"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">to graze</hi>, <hi rend="ital">browse</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pascentes capellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltibus in vacuis pascunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> G 3, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tunc pascebant herbosa Palatia vaccae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire vis, mula, pastum foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—Esp. </sense><sense id="n34012.8" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">pass. reflex.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> force: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera pascuntur viridis armenta per herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascitur in magnā Silā formosa juvenca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondibus et victu pascuntur simplicis herbae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 528</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carice pastus acutā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 231</bibl></cit>; <cb n="PASS" /> 341: <cit><quote lang="la">si pulli non pascentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iterum pasto pascitur ante cibo,</quote> <trans><tr>chews the cud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:17 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 5, 17 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n34012.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Like depascere, with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala gramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes arbuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beluae pastae radices fruticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 3, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34012.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34012.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To feast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gratify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos P. Clodii furor rapinis et incendiis et omnibus exitiis pavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus cruciatu atque supplicio pascere oculos animumque exsaturare,</quote> <trans><tr>to feast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in ejus corpore lacerando ... oculos paverit suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 6:6:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 6, 6, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum picturā pascit inani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes inanes,</quote> <trans><tr>to cherish</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 627</bibl></cit>.—Of style: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quasi eodem cibo pasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:2" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34012.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass. reflex.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his ego rebus pascor, his delector,</quote> <trans><tr>feast myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pasci discordiis civium et seditione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:46:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 46, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hic pascor bibliothecā Fausti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui maleficio et scelere pascuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>live by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otia corpus alunt: animus quoque pascitur illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:4:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pasci dolore alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 280</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34012.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lay waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desolate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestros campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pascent terram Assur in gladio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Mic. 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pasce populum tuum in virgā tuā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pascor: <entryFree id="n34013" type="main" key="pascor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pascor</orth>, <itype>pastus sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, v. pasco, I. B. 4, b., and II. 1. b.</entryFree>
pascua: <entryFree id="n34014" type="main" key="pascu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pascŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. pascuus, II. B.</entryFree>
pascualis: <entryFree id="n34015" type="main" key="pascu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pascŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. pascalis.</entryFree>
pascuosus: <entryFree id="n34016" type="main" key="pascu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pascŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pascuum</etym>, <sense id="n34016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of pasture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit for pasture</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pascuus: <entryFree id="n34017" type="main" key="pascu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pascŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pasco</etym>, <sense id="n34017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for pasture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grazing</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri, arvi et arbusti et pascui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll.—</sense><sense id="n34017.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n34017.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pascŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a pasture</hi> (usu. in <number>plur.</number>; cf. pabulum). </sense><sense id="n34017.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab viridi pascuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne esuriens mittatur in pascuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus quod pascuo caret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 47, 72, § 189</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34017.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in censorum pascuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregem in pascua mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascua laeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:476" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascua herbosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:28" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeta Clitumni pascua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exire in pascua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 44, 61, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam nunc in tabulis censoriis pascua dicuntur omnia, ex quibus populus reditus habet, quia diu hoc solum vectigal fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34017.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">food</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pascua jurulenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34017.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pascŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. terra), <hi rend="ital">a pasture</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 22</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Joel, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:34:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 34, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pasicompsa: <entryFree id="n34018" type="main" key="Pa_si^compsa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāsĭcompsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">pa=s-komyh/</foreign>, alladorned</etym>, <sense id="n34018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:18 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 18 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
pasiphae: <entryFree id="n34019" type="main" key="Pa_si^pha^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāsĭphăē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāsĭphăa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pasifa/h</foreign> (the All-shining), <sense id="n34019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Helios</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Circe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Minos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Androgeus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phœdra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Ariadne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and also of the Minotaur by a beautiful bull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which Venus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out of hatred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">had inspired her with a passion for</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 295</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 43, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 40" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pasiphaen nivei solatur amore juvenci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pasiphaae fano, Cic. Div. l. l.: Pasiphaes gener,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Theseus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:90" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 90</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n34019.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāsĭphăēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pasiphœan.</hi>—In the <hi rend="ital">fem. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāsĭ-phaēïa</orth>, <hi rend="ital">Phœdra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 500</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pasiteles: <entryFree id="n34020" type="main" key="Pa_si^te^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāsĭtĕles</orth>, <case>acc.</case> <itype>en</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pasite/lhs</foreign>, <sense id="n34020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous Greek carver in relief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who came to Rome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc speciem Pasiteles caelavit argento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 45, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:39" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5, 4, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pasithea: <entryFree id="n34021" type="main" key="Pa_si^the^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāsĭthĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāsĭthĕē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pasiqe/a</foreign>, <sense id="n34021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the three Graces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea Pasithea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pasithee,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:286" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 286</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pasitigris: <entryFree id="n34022" type="main" key="Pa_si^ti_gris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāsĭtīgris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pasiti/gris</foreign>, <sense id="n34022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the river Eulœus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the gulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after the union of all its arms</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kuran</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
passales: <entryFree id="n34023" type="gloss" key="passales"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passales</orth> <itype>et oves et gallinae appellantur, quod passim pascuntur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=222" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 222</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
passarius: <entryFree id="n34024" type="main" key="passa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>passus, a, um, from pando</etym>, <sense id="n34024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dried in the sun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Alb. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
passaron: <entryFree id="n34025" type="main" key="Passa^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Passăron</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Passăro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pb n="1312" /> <cb n="PASS" /> = <foreign lang="greek">*passarw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n34025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the district of Molossis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes">33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
passer: <entryFree id="n34026" type="main" key="passer1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passer</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>for panser, from pando; cf. anser</etym>. <sense id="n34026.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sparrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:23:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 23, 75</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 36, 52, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:111" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 38, 54, § 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:158" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 17, 45, § 158</bibl>; 30, 15, 49, § 141; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:30:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 30, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 33, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:2:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 2, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 3</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:6:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:8" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 14</bibl>. 4.—As a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">meus pullus passer, mea columba, mi lepus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34026.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34026.2" n="A" level="2"> Passer marinus. <hi rend="ital">an ostrich</hi> (marinus, because brought from a distance by sea), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=222" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 222</bibl> Müll.—In this signif. also passer alone, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 484, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34026.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A seafish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a turbot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 20, 36, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:125" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34027" type="main" key="Passer2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Passer</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
passercula: <entryFree id="n34028" type="main" key="passercu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passercŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. passer</etym>, <sense id="n34028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little sparrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparrowlet</hi>, as a term of endearment applied to a girl (perh. only in the foll. pass.), M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4</bibl>. 6 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
passerculus: <entryFree id="n34029" type="main" key="passercu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passercŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little sparrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparrowlet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:30:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 30, 65</bibl>.—As a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">dic me igitur tuum passerculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
passerinus: <entryFree id="n34030" type="main" key="passe^ri_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fit for a sparrow</hi>: prandium, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 112, 7</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 213 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34031" type="main" key="Passe^ri_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Passĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a very fleet horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:7:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:36:12" default="NO">12, 36, 12</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In the orthogr PASSARINVS,</quote> <trans><tr>the name of a circus-horse</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 341</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
passernix: <entryFree id="n34032" type="foreign" key="passernix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passernix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <sense id="n34032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a whetstone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 47, § 165</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
passibilis: <entryFree id="n34033" type="main" key="passi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>patior</etym>, <sense id="n34033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">capable of feeling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suffering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passible</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 214</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 26, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jacob. 5, 17</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">passĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">passibly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
passibilitas: <entryFree id="n34034" type="main" key="passi^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>passibilis</etym>, <sense id="n34034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">capability of suffering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passibility</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
passibiliter: <entryFree id="n34035" type="main" key="passi^bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. passibilis <sense id="n34035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
passienus: <entryFree id="n34036" type="main" key="Passi^e_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Passĭēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5 praef.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 106, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1612, 13 sq.</bibl>—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: PASSIENA. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1612, 12 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
passim: <entryFree id="n34037" type="main" key="passim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passim</orth>. <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>passus, from pando</etym> (lit., <sense id="n34037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spread</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scattered about;</hi> hence), <hi rend="ital">at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to different places</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hither and thither</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in every direction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at random.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34037.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): ille iit passim, ego ordinatim, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 2</bibl>: sive pilatim sive passim iter facere volebat, Asellio ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numidae quādam barbarā consuetudine nullis ordinibus passim consederant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrii comites passim ... diversa per agros Tecta metu petiere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima perque vias sternuntur inertia passim Corpora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 364</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 510: volucres passim ac libere solutas opere volitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres huc et illuc passim vagantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:38:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 38, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passim per forum volitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 15, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">passim carpere, colligere undique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 91</bibl></cit>: sparsi enim toto passim campo se diffuderunt, Liv 40, 33, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">41, 3, 7: quin etiam passim nostris in versibus ipsis Multa elementa vides, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 823</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:688" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 688</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34037.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34037.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Far and wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">everywhere</hi>, nearly = ubique (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">passim omnes clamoribus agunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabula et ligna nec pauci petebant, nec passim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tamen haec. quia possunt bene aliquando fieri, passim facienda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:4" default="NO">6, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:13" default="NO">12, 10, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">passim et in quācumque parte nascuntur qui furunculi vocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 12, 77, § 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34037.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Without order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promiscuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscriminately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribimus indocti doctique poëmata passim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres passim semper amarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:69" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 69</bibl></cit> Dissen.: ut Saturnalibus exaequato omnium jure passim in conviviis servi cum dominis recumbant. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:1:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc puto effudisse hoc passim,</quote> <trans><tr>without discrimination</tr>, <tr>heedlessly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: atomi passim cohaerentes, <hi rend="ital">without a plan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at random</hi>, id. de Ira, 10, 27.</sense></entryFree>
passio: <entryFree id="n34038" type="main" key="passi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>patior</etym>, <sense id="n34038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a suffering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enduring</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n34038.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Maxim.</author> Gallus, 3, 42</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 291; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Gnost. 13</bibl>—Esp. (eccl. <cb n="PAST" /> Lat.), <hi rend="ital">the sufferings of Christ</hi>: demus operam, ut mereamur a Deo et ultionem passionis et praemium. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 23, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post passionem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Cor. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34038.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a disease</hi>, Firm. 2, 12.—</sense><sense id="n34038.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34038.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An event</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occurrence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phenomenon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. p. 61, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34038.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A passion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affection</hi>, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pa/qos</foreign>: passio in linguā Latinā, maxime in usu loquendi ecclesiastico, non nisi ad vituperationem consuevit intellegi, Aug. Nupt. et Concup. 33; id. Civ. Dei, 8, 16; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 499</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
passionalis: <entryFree id="n34039" type="main" key="passi^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>passio, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n34039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">susceptible of passion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passionate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Test. Anim. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4</bibl>, n. 83.</sense></entryFree>
passive: <entryFree id="n34040" type="main" key="passi_ve_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. passivus <sense id="n34040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34041" type="main" key="passi_ve_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. passivus <sense id="n34041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
passivitas: <entryFree id="n34042" type="main" key="passi_vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passīvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. passivus</etym>, <sense id="n34042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scattered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confused condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want of distinction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promiscuousness</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
passivitus: <entryFree id="n34043" type="hapax" key="passi_vi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passīvĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, i. q. passim, <sense id="n34043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">everywhere</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
passivus: <entryFree id="n34044" type="main" key="passi_vus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. pando</etym>. <sense id="n34044.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Spread about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">found everywhere</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nomen dei,</quote> <trans><tr>applied to many</tr>, <tr>common</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: cupiditates, Firm. Math. 5, 1.—</sense><sense id="n34044.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Promiscuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seminum passiva congeries,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 177, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34044.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">passīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. q. popularis: vagi Romanorum, quos passivos appellant, Aug. contr. Adamant. 24; so, populari, passivo, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:182" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 182</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">passīvē</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines per colla passive dispositi,</quote> <trans><tr>dispersedly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Psych. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34045" type="main" key="passi_vus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>patior</etym>, <sense id="n34045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">capable of feeling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suffering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passive</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">anima passiva et interibilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34045.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in gram., <hi rend="ital">passive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum passivum . . . quod habet naturam patiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 8</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pas-sīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">passively</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 791</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
passum: <entryFree id="n34046" type="main" key="passum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 2. <itype>pando</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, B. 2. b.</entryFree>
passus: <entryFree id="n34047" type="main" key="passus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of 2. pando.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n34048" type="main" key="passus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of patior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34049" type="main" key="passus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">passus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from the root pat</etym>, <sense id="n34049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a step</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pace</hi> (cf.: gressus, gradus). </sense><sense id="n34049.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: hinc campos celerl passu permensa parumper, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 378, 20</bibl> (Ann. v. 74 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 34</bibl>; Lucr 4, 827; 877; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequiturque patrem non passibus aequis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 724</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec longis inter se passibus absunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 907</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidis ferri Passibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per litora lentis Passibus spatiari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:572" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passu anili procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:533" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 533</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">passibus ambiguis Fortuna errat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:8:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestis (of glory),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34049.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34049.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A footstep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">track</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sint in litore passus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> P 2, 6, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34049.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pace</hi>, as a measure of length, consisting of five Roman feet: <cit><quote lang="la">stadium centum viginti quinque nostros officit passus, hoc est pedes sexcentos viginti quinque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 21, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec exercitum propius urbem millia passuum ducenta admoverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 25, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 12, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pasta: <entryFree id="n34050" type="greek" key="pasta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pasta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/sth</foreign>, <sense id="n34050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">paste</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pasticus: <entryFree id="n34051" type="main" key="pasti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pastus</etym>, <sense id="n34051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fattened</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:6" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pastillarius: <entryFree id="n34052" type="gloss" key="pastilla_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastillārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pastillus</etym>, <sense id="n34052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of pastils</hi>, Inscr. (Ann. p. Chr. 435) Murat. 527, 5.</sense></entryFree>
pastillicans: <entryFree id="n34053" type="hapax" key="pastilli^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastillĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having the shape of a little ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">globular</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21</bibl> 8, 25, § 49.</sense></entryFree>
pastillum: <entryFree id="n34054" type="main" key="pastillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little loaf</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roll of bread</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 24</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">a little round loaf for offering</hi>: pastillum in sacris libi genus rotundi, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pastillus: <entryFree id="n34055" type="main" key="pastillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>panis</etym>, <sense id="n34055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little loaf</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roll</hi>: pastillus forma panis parvi utique deminutivum est a pane, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=222" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 222</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n34055.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, medicine in the form of a round ball or cake, <hi rend="ital">a lozenge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troche</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trochisch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 12, 14, § 29</bibl>: emplastra pastillique, quos <foreign lang="greek">troxi/skous</foreign> Graeci vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 17, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 20</bibl>: sucum <cb n="PAST" /> in sole coctum dividunt in pastillos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 43, § 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">digerere aliquid in pastillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 27, 60, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pastillos cogere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 1, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densare in,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 13, 95, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diluere in,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:12:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 12, 91</bibl></cit>. § 143.—Also of <hi rend="ital">aromatic lozenges</hi>, used to impart an agreeable smell to the breath: <cit><quote lang="la">pastillos Rufillus olet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1</bibl></cit>. 2, 27; 1, 4, 92; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:88:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 88, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pastinaca: <entryFree id="n34056" type="main" key="pasti^na_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastĭnāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pastino</etym>. <sense id="n34056.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A parsnip</hi>, a term including also our <hi rend="ital">carrot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 27, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:112" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 9, 64, § 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34056.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fish of prey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sting-ray</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 42, 67, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:155" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 48, 72, § 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pastinatio: <entryFree id="n34057" type="main" key="pasti^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the act of preparing the soil of a vineyard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by digging and trenching it.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34057.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastinationem suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:4" default="NO">3, 13, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n34057.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">ground so prepared</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastinatio vitibus conserenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:15:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:15" default="NO">3, 3, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pastinator: <entryFree id="n34058" type="main" key="pasti^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who digs and trenches the ground of a vineyard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pastinatum: <entryFree id="n34059" type="main" key="pasti^na_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastĭnātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. pastino <sense id="n34059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pastinatus: <entryFree id="n34060" type="main" key="pasti^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastĭnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pastino</etym>, <sense id="n34060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the act of digging and trenching the ground of a vineyard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 32, § 143</bibl> (al. pastinatum, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
pastino: <entryFree id="n34061" type="main" key="pasti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pastinum</etym>, <sense id="n34061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dig and trench the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare the ground</hi>, for the planting of vines: <cit><quote lang="la">pastinandi agri rationem tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:9" default="NO">11, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastinatae vineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 12, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pastĭnātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. solum), <hi rend="ital">ground dug and trenched; ground prepared for planting the vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam in pastinato serere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 172</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umidum pastinatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:16:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pastinum: <entryFree id="n34062" type="main" key="pasti^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n34062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of two-pronged dibble</hi>, for preparing the ground and for setting plants with: pastinum vocant agricolae ferramentum bifurcum, quo semina panguntur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18</bibl>. 1, and 6.—</sense><sense id="n34062.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34062.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The act of digging up and trenching the ground</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastinum fieri nunc tempus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34062.3" n="B" level="2"> In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">ground so prepared</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec in pastinis vel sulcis ratio erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudo pastinorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 34, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pastio: <entryFree id="n34063" type="main" key="pasti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pasco</etym>, <sense id="n34063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pasturing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grazing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeding.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34063.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo genera sunt pastionum, unum agreste, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:1:8" default="NO">3, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:2:18" default="NO">3, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastiones villaticae, pecuariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34063.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a pasture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl>. 10, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">pastiones laxae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:12:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudine pastionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pastito: <entryFree id="n34064" type="main" key="pasti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastĭto</orth>, v. pascito.</entryFree>
pastophori: <entryFree id="n34065" type="greek" key="pasto^pho^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastŏphŏri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pastofo/roi</foreign>, <sense id="n34065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of priests who carried about the images of their deities in a little shrine for the purpose of collecting alms</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 265, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Ver. 230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pastophorium: <entryFree id="n34066" type="greek" key="pasto^pho^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastŏphŏrĭum</orth>, ii. <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pastofo/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n34066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little chapel in a temple where the image of a god was preserved and his servants abode</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 22, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 4, 38</bibl>; 4, 57.</sense></entryFree>
pastor: <entryFree id="n34067" type="main" key="pastor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastor</orth> (PAASTOR, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3308</bibl>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pasco</etym>, <sense id="n34067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a herdsman</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a shepherd</hi> (syn. opilio): <cit><quote lang="la">Mars pater ... pastores pecuaque salva servassis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos pastores armat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam pastor umbras ... quaerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastor durus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:151" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni pastoris esse tondere pecus, non deglubere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34067.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a shepherd</hi>: populi (transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">poime/na law=n</foreign>, Hom. Il. 2, 243), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34067.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34067.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A keeper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavonum, Varr R. R. 3, 6, 5: columbarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 3:7:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: anserum, Dlg. 32, 1, 66.—</sense><sense id="n34067.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The minister</hi> or <hi rend="ital">superintendent of a church</hi> or <hi rend="ital">congregation</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pastores Israel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 34</bibl></cit>. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">pastores et doctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eph. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of Christ: <cit><quote lang="la">Ego sum pastor bonus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eduxit de mortuis Pastorem magnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 13, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. 1 Pet. 2, 25; 5, 4.</sense></entryFree>
pastoralis: <entryFree id="n34068" type="main" key="pasto_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastōrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pastor</etym>, <sense id="n34068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to herdsmen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shepherds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pastoral</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille Romuli auguratus pastoralis, non urbanus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl></cit>: habitus, Liv 9, 36: juventus, Ov. <pb n="1313" /> <cb n="PATA" /> F. 2, 365: <cit><quote lang="la">myrtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:817" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 817</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans><tr>a band of shepherds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prooem.: <cit><quote lang="la">o pastoralis Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7:22" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pastōrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like a shepherd</hi>, Ven. Fort. Ep. post Carm. 8, 17.</sense></entryFree>
pastoricius: <entryFree id="n34069" type="main" key="pasto_ri_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastōrīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pastor</etym>, <sense id="n34069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a shepherd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pastoral</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R.
