R. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sodalitas pastoricia atque agrestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 11, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pastorius: <entryFree id="n34070" type="main" key="pasto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a herdsman</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shepherd</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:785" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:105" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:17:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <trans><tr>the Palilia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:723" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 723</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pastura: <entryFree id="n34071" type="main" key="pastu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastūra</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pasco</etym>, <sense id="n34071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pasture</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 10, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
pastus: <entryFree id="n34072" type="main" key="pastus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastus</orth>. a, um, <mood>Part.</mood>, from pasco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34073" type="main" key="pastus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pastus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pasco</etym>, <sense id="n34073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pasture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fodder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">food</hi> (class; equally common in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">animalia ad pastum accedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animantia anquirunt pastum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastum capessere et conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e pastu decedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 381</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra fundit ex sese pastus varios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conatum habere ad naturalis pastus capessendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34073.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">food</hi> of men (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">hominum pastus pecudumque cibatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34073.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustenance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populari agros ad praesentem pastum mendicitatis suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastus animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
patagiarius: <entryFree id="n34074" type="main" key="pa^ta^gi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătăgĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>patagium</etym>, <sense id="n34074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bo<*>ler-maker</hi>, Plant. Aul. 3, 5, 35; Inscr. Don. cl. 8, n. 78; ct. Fest. s. v. patagium, p. 221 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
patagiatus: <entryFree id="n34075" type="main" key="pa^ta^gi_a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătăgīātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ornamented with a border</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. Fest. s. v. patagium, p. 221 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
patagium: <entryFree id="n34076" type="greek" key="pa^ta^gi_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătăgīum</orth>, ii. <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">patagei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n34076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gold edging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">border</hi> on a Roman lady's tunic cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">limbus, ora): patagium est, quod ad summam tunicam assui solet: quae et patagiata dicitur et patagiarii, qui ejusmodi opera faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=221" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 221</bibl></cit> Müll.; Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 540, 6</bibl>; Tert <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 144 (2d ed.).—</sense><sense id="n34076.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an ornarient for the kair</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2</bibl>. p. 119, 2</sense></entryFree>
patagus: <entryFree id="n34077" type="greek" key="pa^ta^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătăgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/tagos</foreign>, <sense id="n34077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of disease</hi>, Plaut Fragm ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=221" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 221</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
patalene: <entryFree id="n34078" type="main" key="Pa^ta^le_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătălēnē</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Patăle</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătăla</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*patalhnh</foreign>, <sense id="n34078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island at the mouth of the Indus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a city of the same name.</hi>— <cit><quote lang="la">Form Patalene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 1295</bibl>.—Form Patale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 48, § 132</bibl>.— Form Patale. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 71</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34078.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătălitānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the island of Patalene</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 593</bibl></cit> (Kopp. Patavitanus).</sense></entryFree>
patalis: <entryFree id="n34079" type="greek" key="pa^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătālis</orth>, <itype>e, a false reading for patulus</itype>, v. h. v.)</entryFree>
patalitanns: <entryFree id="n34080" type="main" key="Pa^ta^li_ta^nns"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătălītănns</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Patalene, II.</entryFree>
patara: <entryFree id="n34081" type="main" key="Pa^ta^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*patara</foreign>, <sense id="n34081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaport town of Lycia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a celebrated oracle of Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 28, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 21, 1</bibl>; Serv <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 143</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34081.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pātăreus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), e=i and <itype>ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*patareus</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Patarean</hi>, a surname of Apollo: <cit><quote lang="la">Delius et Patareus Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34081.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătăsaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pararœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 516</bibl></cit>. dumeta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:696" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 696</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34081.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătărēis</orth>, <itype>īdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Patarœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 684</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34081.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătārānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Patarœan</hi> hence, in <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătărāni</orth>, ōrum. <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Patara</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 32, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patavinitas: <entryFree id="n34082" type="main" key="Pa^ta^vi_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătăvīnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Patavium</etym>, <sense id="n34082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mode of speaking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dialectic peculiarities of the Patavians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Patavinity</hi> (ascribed as a fault to Livy by Polliol, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:1:3" default="NO">8, 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patavium: <entryFree id="n34083" type="main" key="Pa^ta^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătăvĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n34083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an important city of</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">in the territory of the</hi> Veneti, <hi rend="ital">founded by Antenor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Livy the historian</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Padua</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 130</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 247</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 7</bibl> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34083.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pă-tăvīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">atavinian. Paduan</hi>: tunicae. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:143:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 143, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Livy's Roman history</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PATE" /> 189.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătăvīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Patavium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Patavinians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patefacio: <entryFree id="n34084" type="main" key="pa^te^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype> (scanned pătēfēcit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 320</bibl>; and in <sense id="n34084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> pătēfīet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1001" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1001</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pateo-facio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw open</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: pando, recludo, aperio). </sense><sense id="n34084.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patefacere et munire alicui aditum ad aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:78:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 78, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures assentatoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 26, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines, aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcum aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 150</bibl></cit>: patefacta triumphis Janua. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter per Alpes patefieri volebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. Inscr. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 27.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">postera lux radiis latum patefecerat orbem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had exposed to view</tr>, <tr>made visible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 794</bibl></cit>.—Esp. (= <foreign lang="greek">a/noi/gein</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to open the way</hi>, as a discoverer or pioneer; <hi rend="ital">to be the first to find</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B G 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus in longas est patefacta vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:36" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 36</bibl></cit>, cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">patefactumque nostris legionibus Pontum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34084.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring to light</hi>: si hoc celatur, in metu; <cit><quote lang="la">sin patefit, in probro sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium suum in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patefacere verum et illustrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patefacere et proferre aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 37, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritas patefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 16, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lentulus patefactus indiciis,</quote> <trans><tr>convicted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cat 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ea proferenda et patefacienda curavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se aliquid patefacturam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
patefactio: <entryFree id="n34085" type="hapax" key="pa^te^facti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĕfactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>patefacio</etym>, <sense id="n34085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laying open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclosing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">making known</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patefactio quast rerum opertarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
patefactus: <entryFree id="n34086" type="main" key="pa^te^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from patefacio.</entryFree>
patefio: <entryFree id="n34087" type="main" key="pa^te^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĕfīo</orth> <itype>fieri</itype>, v. patefacio.</entryFree>
patelana: <entryFree id="n34088" type="main" key="Pa^te^la_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătĕlāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 2. Patella.</entryFree>
patella: <entryFree id="n34089" type="main" key="pa^tella1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>patina</etym>, <sense id="n34089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small pan</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plate;</hi> a vessel used in cooking, and also to serve up food in. </sense><sense id="n34089.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 681</bibl> P.: patella esurienti posita, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 543, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:78:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 78, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:64" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinapi in patellis decoctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 54, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicadae tostae in patellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 8, 21, § 68</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34089.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a vessel used in sacrifices</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an offering - dish</hi>: patellae vasula parva picata sacris faciendis apta, Fest. pp. 248 and 249 Müll.: oportet bonum civem legibus parere et deos colere, in patellam dare, <foreign lang="greek">mikron kreas</foreign>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 544</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere de patellā, of sacrilegious persons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit> Madv. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:310" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 310</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 634</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:26" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:3 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n34089.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34089.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The kneepan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patella</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34089.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A disease of the olive-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24</bibl>. 37, § 223</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34090" type="main" key="Pa^tella2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătella</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătellāna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pă-telāna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pateo</etym>, <sense id="n34090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess that presiaed over the shooting of grain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Patellana numen est et Patella: ex quibus una est pateiactis, patefaciendis rebus altera praestituta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 131</bibl></cit>: Patelana, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8.</sense></entryFree>
patellarius: <entryFree id="n34091" type="main" key="pa^tella_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătellārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. patella</etym>, <sense id="n34091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a dish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plate</hi>, patellaril di, <hi rend="ital">platter-gods</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">the Lares</hi> (because food was set before them in a platter), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 46</bibl>: cf. Schol. ap <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:26" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 26</bibl></sense></entryFree>
patena: <entryFree id="n34092" type="main" key="pa^te^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĕna</orth>. ae, v. 1. patina.</entryFree>
patens: <entryFree id="n34093" type="main" key="pa^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pateo.</entryFree>
patenter: <entryFree id="n34094" type="main" key="pa^tenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> v. pateo, <sense id="n34094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pateo: <entryFree id="n34095" type="main" key="pa^teo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păteo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> root pat. (perh. orig. spat.; cf. spatium); Gr <foreign lang="greek">petannumi, pitnhmi</foreign>, to spread out; <foreign lang="greek">petasma</foreign>, curtain; <foreign lang="greek">petalon</foreign>, leaf; cf.: patulus, patina; also perh. pando (for pantdo)], <sense id="n34095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stand open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be open.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34095.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">januae, aedes patent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facite totae plateae pateant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>. nares semper propter necessarias utilitates patent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:145" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus haec ad visendum patebant cotidie,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 2, 4, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur valvae Concordiae non patent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semitae patuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne fugae quidem patebat locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patuere fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 768</bibl></cit>: (fenestrae) sine <cb n="PATE" /> injuriā patent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 16</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n34095.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n34095.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lie open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be exposed</hi> to any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">patens vulneri equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus ictui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34095.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> (cf. porrigor): <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetiorum fines in longitudinem milia passuum CCXL. patebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">schoenus patet stadia XL.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 30, § 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34095.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34095.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allowable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accessible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attainable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nobis is cursus pateret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quos omnis nobis aditus, qui paene solis patuit, obstructus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia quae pateant stipendiariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut intellegant omnia Ciceronis patere Trebiano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: alicui, <hi rend="ital">to yield to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux aeterna mihi ... dabatur, Si mea virginitas Phoebo patuisset amanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 362</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 83</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34095.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n34095.8" n="1" level="3"> Of the hearing, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready to hear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(constare inter omnis video) patere aurīs tuas querelis omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cujus aures ad hanc disputationem patent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: meas auris ... omnium praeceptis patuisse. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 7, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam nullo magis tempore ad simplices cogitationes pateat animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semita Tranquillae per virtutem patet unica vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:364" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 364</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34095.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be exposed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subject</hi> to any thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 21, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longis morbis senectus, acutis adulescentia magis patet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vanus et excors est patebit contemptui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov 12, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34095.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo vitio latissime patet avaritia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">late patet et ad multos pertinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 235</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34095.11" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">appareo, detegor): operta quae fuere, aperta sunt, patent praestigiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illa pateant in promptuque sint omnibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in tabulis patebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adversariis (hoc nomen) patere contendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pateat aeternum id esse, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 54</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid porro quaerendum est? factumne sit? at constat: a quo? at patet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pă-tens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accessible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unobstructed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34095.12" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum ex omni parte patens atque apertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi patentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locis patentioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via patentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34095.13" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolium quam patentissimi oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34095.14" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34095.15" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exposed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus patens, et exposita cupiditati et voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagoque volans da vela patenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs patens,</quote> <trans><tr>unwalled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:25:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 25, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34095.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 536</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pătenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">openly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patentius et expeditius (opp: implicite et abscondite),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:23:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 23, 69</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
pater: <entryFree id="n34096" type="main" key="pa^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păter</orth>, <itype>tris</itype> (old <sense id="n34096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen</hi> PATRVS. Inscr Corp. Lat. 1469; <hi rend="ital">dat</hi> PATRE, ib 182), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root pā, to nourish, protect; Lat. pasco; hence, Zend, patar, protector; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pathr</foreign>; Sanscr pitri; Engl. father; Germ. Vater</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sire.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34096.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> <hi rend="ital">Aes.</hi> Ehem, pater mi, tu hic eras? <hi rend="ital">De</hi> Tuus hercle vero et animo et patura pater, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patre certo nasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Servius Tullius captivā Corniculanā natus, patre nullo, matre servā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by an unknown father</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SI PATER FILIVM TER VENVM DVIT FILIVS A PATRE LIBER ESTO, Lex XII. Tab.: CORNELIVS SCIPIO BARBATVS GNAIVOD PATRE PROGNATVS, Epit. of the Scipios: ego a patre ita eram deductus,</quote> <trans><tr>by my father</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem patris loco colere debere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34096.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34096.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The father as head and rep resentative of the household</hi>, esp., paterfamilias and paterfamiliae: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci milites patresque familiae recepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemeunque patrem familiae arripuissetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 43</bibl></cit>; v. familia.—</sense><sense id="n34096.4" n="B" level="2"> In <number>plur.</number>: patres, <hi rend="ital">fathers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forefathers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrum nostrorum aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria patrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud patres nostros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 11, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres majoresque nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dominus Deus patrum vestrorum, Vulg Exod 3, 15: descenderunt patres tui in Aegyptum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Deut. 10, 22</bibl></cit>.—So in <hi rend="ital">sing</hi> (eccl. Lat.): dixitque Jacob; <cit><quote lang="la">Deus patris mei Abraham, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 32, 9</bibl></cit>: quod juravit ad Abra. <pb n="1314" /> <cb n="PATE" /> ham patrem nostrūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 1, 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34096.5" n="C" level="2"> PATRES for parentes, <hi rend="ital">parents</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 707, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">656, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">692, 1</bibl>; 704, 1.—</sense><sense id="n34096.6" n="D" level="2"> As a title of honor, <hi rend="ital">father.</hi>—Of a deity, esp. of Jupiter: divum pater atque hominum rex, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 179 Vahl.); cf.: pater optime Olimpi, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 198 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ipse pater mediā nimborum in nocte coruscā Fulmina molitur dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gradivumque patrem Geticis qui praesidet arvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater Lemnius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Vulcan</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacche pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Lenaeus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater Silvane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:21" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: Quirine pater, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 120, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 121 Vahl.): pater Tiberine, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 55 ib.); of <hi rend="ital">the Tiber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apenninus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 703</bibl></cit> Wagner: <cit><quote lang="la">pater Aeneas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 699</bibl></cit>.—Of the creative or generative powers of nature as deities: <cit><quote lang="la">pater Aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 250</bibl></cit>: aequoreus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ocean</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 200.—As an honorable designation applied to senators: <cit><quote lang="la">principes, qui appellati sunt propter caritatem patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:8:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres ab honore patriciique progenies eorum appellati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, patres = patricii, opp. to plebeii: <cit><quote lang="la">quā re ad patres censeo revertare: plebeii quam fuerint importuni, vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres conscripti, v. conscribo: pater patrum, pater sacrorum, pater nomimus, the title given to the high-priest of Mithras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 28, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">315, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1102, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 5059</bibl>: patratus, v. h. v. under <itype>patro</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>—Of the founder of a school: <cit><quote lang="la">Zeno, pater Stoicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:9:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a teacher, as a source or creator: Isocrates pater eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herodotus pater historiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: pater patriae, <hi rend="ital">the father of his country</hi>, of Cicero, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem Q. Catulus, quem multi alii saepe in senatu patrem patriae nominarant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:57:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 57, 121</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma patrem patriae Ciceronem libera dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:245" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 245</bibl></cit>.—So of Marius: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Marium quem vere patrem patriae ... possumus dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 27</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Trajan, and other emperors: at tu etiam nomen patris patriae recusabas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:21" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 8</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: pater senatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:127" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">181</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:95" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 20</bibl>.—As a term of respect: <cit><quote lang="la">pater Aeneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 348</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp., to an old man,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 521</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 533</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34096.7" n="E" level="2"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">the Supreme Being</hi>, <hi rend="ital">God</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut enim Pater habet vitam in semet ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confiteor tibi, Pater Domine caeli et terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pater caelestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 5, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">18, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pater vester qui in caelis est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pater noster, qui es in caelis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adorabunt Patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Joan. 4, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 1, 7</bibl> saep.—* </sense><sense id="n34096.8" n="F" level="1"> Pater cenae, <hi rend="ital">the host</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 1, 3</bibl></cit>. —Hence, by way of opposition, * </sense><sense id="n34096.9" n="G" level="1"> Pater esuritionum, <hi rend="ital">the father of hunger-pains</hi>, said of a very poor man who suffers from hunger, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 21, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34096.10" n="H" level="1"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">sire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virque paterque gregis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 522</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 133 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patera: <entryFree id="n34097" type="main" key="pa^te^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pateo</etym>, <sense id="n34097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a broad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flat dish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">saucer</hi>, used esp. in offerings; <hi rend="ital">a libationsaucer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bowl</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">simpulum, simpuvium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=122" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 122</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humani corporis sanguinem in pateris circumtulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Themistoclem aiunt, cum taurum immolavisset, excepisse sanguinem paterā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinaque marmoreas paterā fundebat in aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pateris libare et auro,</quote> <trans><tr>golden cups</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pateram perplovere in sacris cum dicitur significat pertusam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
paterculus: <entryFree id="n34098" type="main" key="Pa^tercu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătercŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pater</etym>, <sense id="n34098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. C. Velleius Paterculus, <hi rend="ital">the historian;</hi> v. Velleius.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34098.1" n="II" level="1"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păter-cŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Paterculus</hi>, Not. Tir.</sense></entryFree>
paterfamilias: <entryFree id="n34099" type="main" key="pa^terfa^mi^li^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păterfămĭlĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. familia.</entryFree>
paternitas: <entryFree id="n34100" type="main" key="pa^terni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păternĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>paternus</etym>, <sense id="n34100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fatherly feeling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">care</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 232" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 232</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n34100.1" n="2" level="3"> Collect., <hi rend="ital">descendants of one father</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo omnis paternitas in caelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 3, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paternus: <entryFree id="n34101" type="main" key="pa^ternus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păternus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pater</etym>, <sense id="n34101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatherly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paternal</hi> (said <cb n="PATI" /> of the property, possessions, external relations, etc., of a father; while patrius is used of that which belongs essentially to his nature, dignity, or duty; hence, in good prose: patrius amor, animus, patria potestas, patrium jus; but paterni agri, liberi, servi, liberti, etc.). </sense><sense id="n34101.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuria,</quote> <trans><tr>against the father</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud paternum istuc dedisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:17:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 17, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 36, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona paterna et avita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterni animi indoles (a weaker expression than patrii, v. Weissenb. ad loc., and cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 833),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel paternam vel avitam gloriam consequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 33, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem paterno consilio florentissimam accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternum maternumque genus et nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 6, 14</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34101.2" n="B" level="2"> Also (acc. to pater, II. B.), <hi rend="ital">ancestral</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to forefathers</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sepulchra paterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 28, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">traditio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 1, 18.—</sense><sense id="n34101.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34101.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of one's native country</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterni Fluminis ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34101.5" n="B" level="2"> Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34101.6" n="C" level="2"> In gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">casus paternus,</quote> <trans><tr>the genitive case</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 670</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
patesco: <entryFree id="n34102" type="main" key="pa^tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-isco</orth>), <itype>pătŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n34102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [pateo], <hi rend="ital">to be laid open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be opened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to open</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n34102.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">atria longa patescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus patescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patescens fungus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 46, § 95</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34102.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo latior patescit campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque poterat patescere acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates, in quas Germania patescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">latius patescente imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34102.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be disclosed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become visible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio patescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc primum certā notitiā patescente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum vero manifesta fides Danaumque patescunt Insidiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 309</bibl></cit> (but the true reading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 6, 15</bibl> B. and K., is quae res patefecit).</sense></entryFree>
patetus: <entryFree id="n34103" type="greek" key="pa^te_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pathto/s</foreign> (trodden), perhaps only as <sense id="n34103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pătētae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. caryotae), <hi rend="ital">a kind of dates</hi> (which, when they burst open, look as if they had been trodden upon), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:18:108" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 18, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:8:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 4, 8, 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patheticus: <entryFree id="n34104" type="greek" key="pa^the_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păthētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">paqhtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of pathos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pathetic</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">păthētĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">pathetically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractare aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pathicus: <entryFree id="n34105" type="greek" key="pa^thi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păthĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">paqiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">who submits to unnatural lust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pathic;</hi> of men: <cit><quote lang="la">Aureli pathice et cinaede Furi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:99" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 130</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of women,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 25, 41</bibl></cit> and 76.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pathicissimi libelli,</quote> <trans><tr>most lascivious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:96:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 96, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pathos: <entryFree id="n34106" type="main" key="pa^tho^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păthŏs</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/qos</foreign>, <sense id="n34106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pathos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tender</hi> or <hi rend="ital">passionate feeling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">permovere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 6, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
patibilis: <entryFree id="n34107" type="main" key="pa^ti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>patior</etym>. <sense id="n34107.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supportable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endurable</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">tolerabilis, ferendus): patibiles et dolores et labores putandi (sunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:23:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 23, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34107.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34107.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sensitive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patibilem naturam habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34107.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Suffering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum elementum activum, alterum patibile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
patibulatus: <entryFree id="n34108" type="main" key="pa^ti^bu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭbŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>patibulum</etym>, <sense id="n34108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fastened to the</hi> patibulum; <hi rend="ital">yoked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gibbeted</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 53</bibl>: patibulatus ferar per urbem, deinde affigar cruci, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 221, 13</bibl> (al. patibulum): <cit><quote lang="la">exitiabili nexu patibulatum relinquens,</quote> <trans><tr>gibbeted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 147, 4</bibl></cit> (al. patibulum).</sense></entryFree>
patibulum: <entryFree id="n34109" type="main" key="pa^ti^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭbŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n34109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 221, 12</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>) [pateo], <hi rend="ital">a fork-shaped yoke</hi>, placed on the necks of criminals, and to which their hands were tied; also, <hi rend="ital">a fork-shaped gibbet</hi> (syn. furca). </sense><sense id="n34109.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispessis manibus patibulum quom habebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: patibulo eminens adfigebatur, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 4, 355</bibl> (Hist. 4, 40 Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">caedes, patibula, ignes, cruces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:41:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 41, § 90</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>: deligat ad patibulos, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 221, 12</bibl>: suspende<cb n="PATI" />  eos contra solem in patibulis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Num 25, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34109.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A forked prop</hi> for vines, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 212</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34109.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wooden bar</hi> for fastening a door, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 366, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patibulus: <entryFree id="n34110" type="main" key="pa^ti^bu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭbŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pateo</etym>, <sense id="n34110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fastened to a</hi> patibulum; <hi rend="ital">yoked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gibbeted</hi>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 221, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 147</bibl> (in both passages al. leg. patibulatum; v. patibulatus).</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n34111" type="main" key="pa^ti^bu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. patibulum.</entryFree>
paticabulum: <entryFree id="n34112" type="gloss" key="pa^ti^ca_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭcābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, perhaps from pateo, in the sense of <sense id="n34112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cistern</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pond</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Atti de' Fratelli Arv. p. 70.</sense></entryFree>
patiens: <entryFree id="n34113" type="main" key="pa^ti^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from patior.</entryFree>
patienter: <entryFree id="n34114" type="main" key="pa^ti^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. patior, <sense id="n34114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
patientia: <entryFree id="n34115" type="main" key="pa^ti^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>patior</etym>, <sense id="n34115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the quality of bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffering</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">enduring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endurance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34115.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34115.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pati entia est honestatis aut utilitatis causā rerum arduarum ac difficilium voluntaria ac diuturna perpessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:163" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientia famis et frigoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum ea patientia, virtus frugalitasque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:24:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 24, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:9" default="NO">12, 9, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34115.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">submission to unnatural lust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pathicism</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:16:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 13:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 9</bibl> and 25; Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 5, 3, 2.—</sense><sense id="n34115.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34115.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Forbearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indulgence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lenity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantiam dico? nescio an melius patientiam possem dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quousque tandem abutere, Catilina, patientiā nostrā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem duplici panno patientia velat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levius fit patientiā Quicquid corrigere est nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 24, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34115.6" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">indolence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want of spirit</hi>: ne quis in me aut nimiam patientiam, aut nimium stuporem arguat, Porc. Latro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in patientiā firmitudinem simulans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34115.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Submissiveness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad servilem patientiam demissus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britanniam uno praelio veteri patientiae restituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patigran: <entryFree id="n34116" type="main" key="Patigran"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Patigran</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Patigrans</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n34116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Media</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patina: <entryFree id="n34117" type="main" key="pa^ti^na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pătĕna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pateo</etym>, <sense id="n34117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a broad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shallow dish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stewpan</hi> (cf.: lanx, catinus). </sense><sense id="n34117.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut patinae fervent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mi inter patinas exhibes argutias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamdudum animus est in patinis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>my belly has been crying cupboard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 8</bibl>, a, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">muraena In patinā porrectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 33, § 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fictiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 11, 25, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orobanche estur et per se et in patinis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cooked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 80, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patinae ob immensam magnitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deerat pisci patinae mensura,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a dish large enough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34117.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34117.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of cake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34117.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A crib</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manger</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34118" type="main" key="Pati^na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Patĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Patina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 17, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
patinarius: <entryFree id="n34119" type="main" key="pa^ti^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. patina</etym>, <sense id="n34119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a dish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pan</hi>: piscis. <hi rend="ital">stewed in a pan with sauce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">strues,</quote> <trans><tr>a pile of dishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mer. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis incendiarium et patinarium vociferantibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gormandizer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>.— Via patinaria, <hi rend="ital">a street in Rome</hi>, P. Vict. de Reg. Urb. R.</sense></entryFree>
patio: <entryFree id="n34120" type="main" key="pa^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭo</orth>, <itype>patĕre</itype>, v. patior <sense id="n34120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
patior: <entryFree id="n34121" type="main" key="pa^ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭor</orth>, <itype>passus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (<sense id="n34121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> archaic collat. form patiunto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 4, 11</bibl>: patias, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 395</bibl> P.) [cf. Greek <foreign lang="greek">*p*a*q, *p*e*n*q-, pe/ponqa, pe/nqos</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undergo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi> (syn.: fero, tolero). </sense><sense id="n34121.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34121.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n34121.3" n="1" level="3"> Tu fortunatu's, ego miser: <cit><quote lang="la">patiunda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortiter malum qui patitur, idem post potitur bonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 58</bibl></cit> Ussing (al. patitur bonum): <cit><quote lang="la">o passi graviora!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:1:24" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli injurias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toleranter dolores pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:18:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissimum supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
