C. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia saeva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et facere et pati fortiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec patienda censeo potius, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal damnum haud aegerrime passus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1315" /> <cb n="PATI" /> aliae nationes servitutem pati possunt, populi Romani propria est libertas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremam pati fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequo animo magnum morbum pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentietur in tormentis qui dolorem pati potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nec totam servitutem pati possunt, nec totam libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potest generosus animus servitutem pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemem et aestatem juxta pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34121.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor tristis res est . . . ad patiendum tolerandumque difficilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 75</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34121.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meet with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be visited</hi> or <hi rend="ital">afflicted with</hi> (mostly postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incommodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid in captivum invenire potest, passurum te esse cogita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem pati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 50, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignam necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem modicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversa proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilitatem famemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 28, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cladem pati (post-Aug. for cladem accipere, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 36 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">naufragium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 118" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 17, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:15:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 15, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruciatus corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 6:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 65:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 65, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut is in culpā sit, qui faciat, non is qui patiatur injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 78</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de tribus unum esset optandum: aut facere injuriam nec accipere ... optimum est facere, impune si possis, secundum nec facere nec pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:13:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 13, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34121.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n34121.7" n="1" level="3"> In mal. part., <hi rend="ital">to submit to another's lust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prostitute one's self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 87</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">140</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34121.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass a life of suffering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">privation</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">certum est in silvis inter spelaea ferarum Malle pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novem cornix secula passa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 274</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 313</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 470" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 470</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n34121.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34121.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">sino, permitto): illorum delicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 141</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tibi bene esse patere, et illis, quibus est, invides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">siquidem potes pati esse te in lepido loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista non modo homines, sed ne pecudes quidem passurae esse videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobiscum versari jam diutius non potes: non feram, non patiar, non sinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum illius ineuntis aetatis meae patiebatur pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo se implicari negotio passus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo spondei non fere se jungi patiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut persuasurum se aut persuaderi sibi passurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vinci se consensu civitatis pateretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 23, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 23</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim dilationem pati tam vicinum bellum poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recentis animi alter (consul) ... nullam dilationem patiebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 52, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum pati, Quin tibi caput demulceam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum patiebatur esse diem, quin in foro diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:302" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 88, 302</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec plura querentem Passa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 385</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 421</bibl> (= passa queri, etc.).—Hence, facile, aequo animo pati, <hi rend="ital">to be well pleased</hi> or <hi rend="ital">content with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to acquiesce in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submit to</hi>: aegre, iniquo animo, moleste pati, <hi rend="ital">to be displeased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indignant at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso aequo animo patitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud me plus officii residere facillime patior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium meum a te probari ... facile patior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 2, § 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum indigne pateretur nobilis mulier ... in conventum suam mimi filiam venisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">31: periniquo patiebar animo, te a me digredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34121.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To submit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patior quemvis durare laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro quo bis patiar mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34121.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To experience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undergo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be in a certain state of mind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">temper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne quiddam pati furori simile videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34121.13" n="C" level="2"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">to be passive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have a passive sense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(verbum) cum haberet naturam patiendi,</quote> <trans><tr>a passive nature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modus patiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:7" default="NO">9, 3, 7</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supporting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permitting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34121.14" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis navium patiens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>navigable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 31, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 223</bibl></cit>: vetustatis,<cb n="PATR" />  <hi rend="ital">lasting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 76, § 196</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus patiens sessoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34121.15" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34121.16" n="1" level="3"> That has the quality of enduring, <hi rend="ital">patient</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium patiens et lentus existimor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:75:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 75, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meae quoque litterae te patientiorem lenioremque fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientissimae aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientissimus exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34121.17" n="2" level="3"> That has the power of endurance, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unyielding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">patiens aratrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxo patientior illa Sicano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 29</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pătĭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">patiently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum patienter accipere, non repugnanter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patienter et fortiter ferre aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patienter et aequo animo ferre difficultates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandere olus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientius alicujus potentiam ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientissime ferre aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
patiscens: <entryFree id="n34122" type="main" key="pa^tiscens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătiscens</orth>, v. patesco.</entryFree>
patmos: <entryFree id="n34123" type="main" key="Patmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Patmos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/tmos</foreign>, <sense id="n34123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island of the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Sporades</hi>, a place of banishment of the Romans, now <hi rend="ital">Patino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pator: <entryFree id="n34124" type="main" key="pa^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pător</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pateo</etym>, <sense id="n34124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an opening</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 111, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, p. 137 et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">narium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 46" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 46</bibl></cit> and 47.</sense></entryFree>
patrae: <entryFree id="n34125" type="main" key="Pa_^trae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pā^trae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/trai</foreign>, <sense id="n34125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient city in Achaia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the promontory of Rhium</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Patras</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 28, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 417</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n34125.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pā^trensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Patrœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Patrœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lyso Patrensis,</quote> <trans><tr>of Patrœ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:19:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 19, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibliotheca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:9:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătren-ses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Patrœans</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Patrensium leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 19, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
patraster: <entryFree id="n34126" type="gloss" key="pa^traster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătraster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pater</etym>, <sense id="n34126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fatherin-law</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Ver. 360, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1632, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1958, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patratio: <entryFree id="n34127" type="main" key="pa_^tra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>patro</etym>, <sense id="n34127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an effecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">achieving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplishing</hi> (rare and postAug.). </sense><sense id="n34127.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:98:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 98, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34127.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in mal. part., Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patrator: <entryFree id="n34128" type="main" key="pa_^tra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an effecter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">achiever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplisher</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">necis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 20</bibl></cit>: illustrium operum atque signorum, Hier. in Isa. prol. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
patratus: <entryFree id="n34129" type="main" key="pa^tra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from patro; v. patro <sense id="n34129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
patrensis: <entryFree id="n34130" type="main" key="Pa_^trensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pā^trensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Patrae, II.</entryFree>
patria: <entryFree id="n34131" type="main" key="pa_^tri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. patrius, II. C. 1.</entryFree>
patriarcha: <entryFree id="n34132" type="main" key="pa^tri^archa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătrĭarcha</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pătrĭarches</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">patria/rxhs</foreign>, <sense id="n34132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chief of a tribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a patriarch.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34132.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum patriarchas et ceteros majores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cor. Mil. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 534</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:8:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 8, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 7, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi> patriarchūm, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 24, 209</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34132.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a chief bishop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a patriarch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. Saturn. 8, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34132.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi, patriarchae ut ita dixerim, haereticorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
patriarchicus: <entryFree id="n34133" type="main" key="pa^tri^archi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătrĭarchĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>patriarcha</etym>, <sense id="n34133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a patriarch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patriarchal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Novell. 7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Novell. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
patrice: <entryFree id="n34134" type="main" key="pa_^tri^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. patricus <sense id="n34134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
patriciatus: <entryFree id="n34135" type="main" key="pa^tri^ci^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătrĭcĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>patricius</etym>, <sense id="n34135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the rank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dignity of the patricians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 2</bibl>.—From the time of Constantine, <hi rend="ital">a high dignity at the imperial court</hi>, a rank next to that of the emperor, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patricida: <entryFree id="n34136" type="main" key="pa_^tri^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭcīda</orth>, v. parricida.</entryFree>
patricia: <entryFree id="n34137" type="main" key="Patri^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Patrĭcĭa Cŏlōnĭa</orth>, <sense id="n34137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Roman colony of</hi> Corduba, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Hispania Baetica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 11</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34137.1" n="II" level="1"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Patrĭcĭen-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Corduba</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 432, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">460, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patricii: <entryFree id="n34138" type="main" key="pa_^tri^ci^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭcĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. patricius, II.</entryFree>
patriciolus: <entryFree id="n34139" type="gloss" key="pa_^tri^ci^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭcĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, from patricius, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 610</bibl> P.</entryFree>
patricius: <entryFree id="n34140" type="main" key="pa_^tri^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭcĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭtĭus</orth>, Aug. Mon. Ancyr.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>patres</etym>, <sense id="n34140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the rank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dignity of the</hi> patres; <hi rend="ital">belonging to the patricians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patrician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi> (cf. nobilis): <cit><quote lang="la">patricii pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:59:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 59, 2</bibl>: gens, <cb n="PATR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:332" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 332</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:61" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:97" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 97</bibl></cit>: Patricius Vicus Romae dictus eo, quod ibi patricii habitaverunt (the mod. <hi rend="ital">Via Urbana</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=221" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 221</bibl> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n34140.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (usu. <number>plur.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭcĭi</orth>, ōrum), <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a patrician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a member of the Roman nobility</hi>, divided into patricii majorum and minorum gentium (of the older and younger families): <cit><quote lang="la">olim patricii dicebant, plebiscitis se non teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres ab honore, patriciique progenies eorum appellati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patricios Cincius ait appellari solitos, qui nunc ingenui vocentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=241" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 241</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:35:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 35, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patricii minorum gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Sulla) primus e patriciis Corneliis igni voluit cremari,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Cornelian patricians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exire e patriciis,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass</tr>, <tr>by adoption</tr>, <tr>into a plebeian family</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:190" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:24" default="NO">1, 24</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi qui patricius sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 16, 62</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34140.2" n="B" level="2"> From the time of the emperor Constantine, patricius became <hi rend="ital">the title of a person high in office at court</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1076, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> 2, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patricus: <entryFree id="n34141" type="main" key="pa_^tri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pater</etym>, <sense id="n34141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatherly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paternal;</hi> in gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">patricus casus,</quote> <trans><tr>the genitive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 66</bibl></cit> Müll.; 8, § 67 ib.; 9, § 54 ib; 9, § 67 ib.; 9, § 85 ib.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pă-trĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">paternally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of a father</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cesso magnifice patriceque ita ero meo ire advorsum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
patrie: <entryFree id="n34142" type="main" key="pa^tri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. patrius <sense id="n34142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
patrimes: <entryFree id="n34143" type="gloss" key="pa^tri_mes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătrīmes</orth>, v. patrimus <sense id="n34143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
patrimonialis: <entryFree id="n34144" type="main" key="pa_^tri^mo_ni^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭmōnĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>patrimonium</etym> <sense id="n34144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a patrimony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patrimonial</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: fundi, Cod. Th. 11, 16, 1; 2; 9.</sense></entryFree>
patrimoniolum: <entryFree id="n34145" type="main" key="pa^tri^mo_ni^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătrĭmōnĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little patrimony</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 45</bibl>, n. 15.</sense></entryFree>
patrimonium: <entryFree id="n34146" type="main" key="pa_^tri^mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭmōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pater</etym>, <sense id="n34146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an estate inherited from a father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a paternal estate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inheritance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patrimony</hi> (syn. hereditas). </sense><sense id="n34146.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lauta et copiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 36, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplum et copiosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expellere aliquem e patrimonio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 50, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonio ornatissimo spoliari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 20, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naufragium patrimonii luculentissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonia effundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">devorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eripere patrimonium alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:52:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 52, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplificare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prooem. § 7; Aug. Mon. Ancyr. et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:116" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:3:42" default="NO">3, 42</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n34146.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in populi Romani patrimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut plebem tribus suis patrimoniis deleniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mucius quasi patrimonii propugnator sui,</quote> <trans><tr>inheritance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterni nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:58:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 58, 146</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
patrimus: <entryFree id="n34147" type="main" key="pa^tri_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătrīmus</orth> (quantity of the penult uncertain; <sense id="n34147.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">v. matrimus), a, um (collat. form: MATRIMES ac PATRIMES dicuntur, quibus matres et patres adhuc vivunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=126" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 126</bibl></cit> Müll.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">that has a father living</hi>: decem ingenui, decem virgines, patrimi omnes matrimique (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)mfiqalei=s</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 11, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 2</bibl>; Cic. Lael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6, 13</bibl>; Fest. s. v. patrimi, p. 245 Müll.; cf. Mercklin in Zeitschr. f. Alterth. Wiss. 12. Jahrg., Heft 2. pp. 97- 122. (The remark of Servius, ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 31</bibl>, that patrimi and matrimi were names applied to the children that sprung from a marriage contracted by confarreatio, appears to be unfounded.)</sense></entryFree>
patriota: <entryFree id="n34148" type="main" key="pa_^tri^o_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">patriw/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n34148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a countryman</hi>, Gregor. Ep. 8, 37.</sense></entryFree>
patrioticus: <entryFree id="n34149" type="main" key="pa_^tri^o_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (patria), <sense id="n34149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to one's native land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsio,</quote> <trans><tr>in the mothertongue</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
patri: <entryFree id="n34150" type="main" key="pa_^tri^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭ-passĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>paterpatior</etym>, <sense id="n34150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">believers in the doctrine of Noëtus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that the Supreme Father suffered in the death of Jesus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 8, 5, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patrisso: <entryFree id="n34151" type="greek" key="pa_^trisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trisso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">patrīzo</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">patri/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n34151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take after one's father</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tene id mirari, si patrissat finus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patritus: <entryFree id="n34152" type="main" key="pa^tri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pater, like avitus from avus</etym>, <sense id="n34152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of one's father</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forefathers</hi> <pb n="1316" /> <cb n="PATR" /> (an archaic word, which, however, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 45</bibl>, is suspected without sufficient cause): avito ac patrito more, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 161, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum leges patritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 161, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrita et avita philosophia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit> (Klotz); <cit><quote lang="la">Lex. Thor lin. 28: subleva misericordiā aetatem familiarem tibi et patritam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Amic. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Amic. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sedem patritam referri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 87</bibl></cit>: Jesum Valentiniani cognominant Soterem de patritis, <hi rend="ital">after the example of their fathers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forefathers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patrius: <entryFree id="n34153" type="main" key="pa_^tri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pater</etym>, <sense id="n34153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatherly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paternal</hi> (for syn. v paternus). </sense><sense id="n34153.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34153.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">esse exitio rei patriae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem patriam et gloriam majorum foedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus patrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res patria atque avita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:17:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 17, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus et potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 45, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maeror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 42, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 643</bibl></cit>: arae. i. e. <hi rend="ital">of Father Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 723</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrium mimae donare fundum laremque, Hor S. 1, 2, 56: dolor pedum,</quote> <trans><tr>hereditary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: ucerbitas, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of his father</hi>, Liv 7, 5, 7: di patrii, <hi rend="ital">of one's forefathers.</hi> like <foreign lang="greek">qeoi patrw=|oi</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">family gods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">household gods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:20:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 20, 75</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:17" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 17</bibl>; Hyg. ap. Macr S. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc patrium est, potius consuefacere filium Suā sponte recte facere quam alieno metu, Ter Ad. 1, 1, 49.—Rarely, like paternus. = patris. patriā virtute praeditus filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 21, 48</bibl></cit> sepulchrum patrium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas patrias persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: corpus patrium. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrio instituto deditus studio litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 20, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">59, 213</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos patrius et disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum patrium atque avitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 8, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34153.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">patrius casus,</quote> <trans><tr>the genitive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:16:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. patricus and paternus.—</sense><sense id="n34153.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n34153.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Handed down from one's forefathers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old-established</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancient</hi> (very rare): mos. <hi rend="ital">hereditary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">old-established custom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:18:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 18, 84</bibl>: leges. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34153.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Hereditary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiar</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">praediscere patrios cultusque habitusque locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrius hic (pedum dolor) illi,</quote> <trans><tr>the gout</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>. pavor genti, Sil 15, 722: <cit><quote lang="la">adde, cruentis Quod patriura saevire Dahis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:157" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 157</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34153.7" n="C" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n34153.8" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (old <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> patrial, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 41</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">f</hi> (sc. terra) </sense><sense id="n34153.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">One's fatherland</hi>, <hi rend="ital">native land</hi> or <hi rend="ital">country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">native place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erilis patria, salve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eram imperator in patriā meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 75</bibl></cit>: patria, quae communis est omnium nostrum parens. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes omnium caritates patria una complexa est.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>: o pater, o patria, o Priami domus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 118 Vahl.); cf.: o patria, o divum domus Ilium, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 241</bibl>; imitated by Verg. l. l.: o Romule, Romule die, Qualem te patriae custodem di genuerunt, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 41, 64</bibl> (Ann. v. 116 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">patriā Atheniensis an Lacedaemonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:24:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 24, 35</bibl></cit>: Hispaniam sibi antiquam patriam esse, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 380</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34153.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A dwelling-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">home</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habuit alteram loci patriam, alteram juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam quaero patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 380</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exuere patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agr 32</bibl>: patria major = <foreign lang="greek">mhtro/polis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the mother-city</hi> of colonists, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 5</bibl>.—Hence, prov.: patria est, ubicumque est bene, Poët. (prob. Pacuv.) ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia propheta in suā patriā honorem non habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 4, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 4, 24</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of things; Nilus, Qui patriam tantae tam bene celat aquae, <hi rend="ital">the home</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the source</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimborum in patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divisae arboribus patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 116</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">una atque eadem est vini patria atque magistri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:161" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 161</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n34153.11" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. nomen), i. q. patronymicum, <hi rend="ital">a patronymic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5</bibl>, <cb n="PATR" /> 45.—*</sense><sense id="n34153.12" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">paternally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrie monere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34154" type="main" key="pa_^tri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>patria</etym>. <sense id="n34154.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to one's native country</hi> or <hi rend="ital">home</hi>, <hi rend="ital">native</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrius sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen patrium canere,</quote> <trans><tr>a national song</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mycenae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>their home</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palaestrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34154.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in gram.: nomen patrium, <hi rend="ital">a gentile noun</hi> (like Romanus, Atheniensis, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 580</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
patrizo: <entryFree id="n34155" type="main" key="pa^trizo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătrizo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. patrisso.</entryFree>
patro: <entryFree id="n34156" type="main" key="pa_^tro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^tro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; prob. from root pat- of pateo, q. v.; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">patos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n34156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">achieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclude</hi> (rarely used by Cic., by Cæs. not at all; syn.: conficio, perago, perpetro). </sense><sense id="n34156.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sementim patraveris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operibus patratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring the war to an end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 75:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 75, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:79:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 79, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:123" default="NO">123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:15:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 15, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 70, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 18, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J 13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 53, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <trans><tr>to conclude a peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusjurandum, as pater patratus (v. infra),</quote> <trans><tr>to pronounce the customary form of oath in making a treaty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 24, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa,</quote> <trans><tr>to execute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrata victoria,</quote> <trans><tr>obtained</tr>, <tr>gained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrati remedii gloria,</quote> <trans><tr>the glory of the effected cure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 81</bibl></cit> multas mortes jussu Messalinae patratas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 28</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n34156.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in mal. part.: patranti fractus ocello. i. e. <hi rend="ital">with a lascivious eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt lusci oculi atque patrantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 3, 160, 3</bibl></cit>. (Cf., respecting the accessory notion of patrare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 44</bibl>.)—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trātus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> (as if from patror, āri), in the phrase pater patratus, <hi rend="ital">the fetial priest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who ratified a treaty with religious rites</hi>: pater patratus ad jusjurandum patrandum, id est sanciendum fit foedus, Liv 1, 24, 6; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 206</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patrobius: <entryFree id="n34157" type="main" key="Pa_^tro^bi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pā^trŏbĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a freedman of the emperor Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 13, 47, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patrocinalis: <entryFree id="n34158" type="gloss" key="pa_^tro_ci^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trōcĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>patrocinium</etym>, <sense id="n34158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to protection</hi> or <hi rend="ital">patronage</hi>: TABVLAE PATROCINALES, <hi rend="ital">the patronage tab lets</hi>, on which was engraved the decree of the chief magistrate of a municipium or a colony, appointing a patron for it, and which were transmitted to him, Inscr. Romanelli, Topogr Napol. tom. iii. p. 147.</sense></entryFree>
patrocinatus: <entryFree id="n34159" type="main" key="pa_^tro_ci^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trōcĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. patrocinor <sense id="n34159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
patrocinium: <entryFree id="n34160" type="main" key="pa_^tro_ci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trōcĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>patrocinor</etym>, <sense id="n34160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pro tection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patronage</hi> (cf.: praesidium, clientela, tutela). </sense><sense id="n34160.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">patrocinia appellari coepta, cum plebs distributa est inter patres, ut eorum opibus tuta esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=233" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 233</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud patrocinium orbis terrae verius, quam imperium poterat nominari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus patrocinio civitas plurimum utebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 41, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. Or. Philippi contra Lepid.: utraque factio Macedonum patrociniis nitebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 354, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n34160.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas plurimorum patrociniis defenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficultatis patrocinia praeteximus segnitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa patrocinio non bona pejor erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 3, 4, § 23</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n34160.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a defence</hi> in a court of justice, <hi rend="ital">a pleading</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc dicendi genus ad patrocinia mediocriter aptum videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:29:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 29, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legitimarum et civilium controversiarum patrocinia suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 34, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arripere patrocinium aequitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquae (controversiae) in meum quoque inciderunt patrocinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:40" default="NO">5, 13, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrocinium feneratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34160.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr.: patrocinia, <hi rend="ital">persons defended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clients</hi>, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patrocinor: <entryFree id="n34161" type="main" key="pa_^tro_ci^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trōcĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n34161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [patronus], <hi rend="ital">to protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patronize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish a defence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">protection to</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n34161.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indotatis patrocinari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 46</bibl></cit>: <cb n="PATR" /> ut non homini patrocinemur sed crimin:. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrocinari sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 148</bibl></cit>: ne ad illud quidem confugere possis, quod plerisque patrocinatur. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne indignus est, cui exceptio patrocinetur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: loco, <hi rend="ital">to defend the place</hi>, Auct. Bell. Hisp. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n34161.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrocinari enim hoc esse aiunt, non judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34161.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <case>acc.</case> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 1, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: patrocinatus, in a pass. signif., <hi rend="ital">protected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defended</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patrocles: <entryFree id="n34162" type="main" key="Pa^tro_^cles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătrō^cles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. Patroclus.</entryFree>
patroclianus: <entryFree id="n34163" type="main" key="Patroclia_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Patrocliānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Patroclus, II.</entryFree>
patroclus: <entryFree id="n34164" type="main" key="Pa_^tro_^clus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pā^trō^clus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pā^trĭcŏ-les</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 38</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 92</bibl> Vahl.—Gr. <case>acc.</case> Patroclon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 33</bibl> Müll.; al. Patroclen), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pa/troklos</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*patroklh=s</foreign>. <sense id="n34164.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Menœtius and Sthenele</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the friend of Achilles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain in single combat by Hector</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 97" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:73 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 73 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n34164.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise unknown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from whom the</hi> Patroclianae sellae (i. e. latrinae) <hi rend="ital">take their name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:77:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 77, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34164.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of an elephant of king Antiochus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 5, 5, § 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patron: <entryFree id="n34165" type="main" key="Pa_^tro_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pā^trōn</orth>, <itype>ōnĭs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the companions of Evander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 298</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patrona: <entryFree id="n34166" type="main" key="pa_^tro_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n34166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [patronus], <hi rend="ital">a protectress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patroness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34166.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34166.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">bonam atque opsequentem deam atque haut gravatam patronam execuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te mihi patronam capio. Thais,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 48</bibl></cit> cum lex ipsa sociorum atque amicorum populi Romani patrona sit. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div in Caecil. 20, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34166.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the mistress of a freedman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a patroness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 4, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34166.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a protectress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">provocatio patrona illa civitatis ac vindex libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:72:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 72, 14</bibl>.—Of the tongue, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patronalis: <entryFree id="n34167" type="main" key="pa_^tro_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a patron</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundia,</quote> <trans><tr>towards one's patron</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:5:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: HONOR, Inscr. Grut 1101, 1 (al. PATRONATVS HONOR).</sense></entryFree>
patronatus: <entryFree id="n34168" type="main" key="pa_^tro_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trōnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the character and condition of a patron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patronship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patronage</hi> (late Lat.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">patrocinium),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 564, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus patronatus,</quote> <trans><tr>the sum of the rights of a patron over his freedman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37</bibl></cit>, tit. 14 (v Sandars ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 5, 3</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">omni commodo patronatus carere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:14:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amissi patronatus jus recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
patronus: <entryFree id="n34169" type="main" key="pa_^tro_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trōnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pater</etym>. <sense id="n34169.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a protector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patron</hi> (of individuals, or of cities and entire provinces; also, the former master of a freedman); PATRONVS SI CLIENTI FRAVDEM FECERIT SACER ESTO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 609</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">quot enim clientes circa singulos fuistis patronos, tot nunc, etc., Liv 6, 18, 6: ego me patronum profiteor plebis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 18, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">civitatum et nationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 11, 25</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum conventus ille Capuae, qui me unum patronum adoptavit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; Inscr. A. U. C. 742, Marin. Fratr Arv. p. 782; see also <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 956</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1079</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3056</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">patronus, defensor, custos coloniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 21, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1, 2</bibl>.—Of the former master of a freedman or freedwoman: <cit><quote lang="la">volo me placere Philolachi, meo patrono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: civis Romani liberti hereditatem Lex XII. Tabularum patrono defert, si intestato sine suo herede libertus decesserit, Ulp. Fragm. tit. 29, § 1; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:40" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 21, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corrupti in dominos servi, in patronos liberti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34169.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a defender before a court of justice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an advocate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleader</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">advocatus, causidicus, procurator, cognitor): judicis est semper in causis verum sequi, patroni nonnumquam verisimile, etiamsi minus sit verum, defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 280</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patronus alicui causae constitui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">his de causis ego huic causae patronus exstiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Lex. Servil. lin. 9: patronus partis adversae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">patronus adversarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34169.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a defender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advocate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam legem a vestrorum commodorum patrono esse conscriptam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foederum ac foederatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui modo patronus nunc cupit esse cliens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A.
