A. 1, 88</bibl></cit>.—Comically: <pb n="1317" /> <cb n="PATU" /> video ego te, propter malefacta qui es patronus parieti, i. e. <hi rend="ital">standing like a patron in front of the wall</hi> (of one who, for fear of blows, places himself with his back to the wall, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 48</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 12</bibl>. —As an affectionate and respectful form of address: <cit><quote lang="la">mi patrone, immo potius mi pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patronymicus: <entryFree id="n34170" type="greek" key="pa^tro_ny^mi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătrōnymĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">patrwnumiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n34170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">formed after a father's name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patronymic;</hi> in gram.: patronymicum nomen, <hi rend="ital">a patronymic</hi>, as Anchisides from Anchises, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 582</bibl> P. et saep.</sense></entryFree>
patruelis: <entryFree id="n34171" type="main" key="pa_^tru^e_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trŭēlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<case>abl.</case> patruele, Nep. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 113</bibl> P.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>patruus</etym>, <sense id="n34171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">descended from a father's brother</hi> (cf. consobrinus, descended from a mother's sister). </sense><sense id="n34171.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: patrueles marium fratrum filii; <cit><quote lang="la">consobrini ex duabus editi sororibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 557, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">item fratres patrueles, sorores patrueles, id est qui quaeve ex duobus fratribus progenerantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:1:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:10" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater tuus erat frater patruelis meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Cicero frater noster cognatione patruelis, amore germanus,</quote> <trans><tr>my cousin by blood</tr>, <tr>my brother in affection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 11, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34171.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trŭēlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a father's brother's son</hi> or <hi rend="ital">daughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cousin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patruelis suus,</quote> <trans><tr>his cousin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum e patruelibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patruelis nulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:52" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 8, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n34171.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a father's sister's son</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cousin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34171.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a father's brother's child</hi> or <hi rend="ital">children</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of one's cousin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cousins</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">patruelia regna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Danaus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 61</bibl></cit>: patruelia dona, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the arms of Achilles</hi> (whose father was the brother of Ajax's father), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">origo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:352" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 352</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
patruus: <entryFree id="n34172" type="main" key="pa_^tru^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pā^trŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pater, like the Sanscr. pitrivya, patruus, from pitri</etym>, <sense id="n34172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a father's brother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paternal uncle</hi> (opp. avunculus, a mother's brother, maternal uncle); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n34172.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Cicero patruus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutor et patruus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:53:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 53, § 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patruus magnus = frater avi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patruus major = frater proavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10</bibl>: major patruus = avi et aviae patruus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=136" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 136</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">patruus maximus = frater abavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> Fragm. 17; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:158" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:567" default="NO">6, 567</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34172.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a severe reprover</hi> (as uncles are apt to co towards their nephews): <cit><quote lang="la">pertristis quidam patruus, censor, magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sis patruus mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sapimus patruos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 449</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34173" type="main" key="pa^tru^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătrŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. patruus</etym>, <sense id="n34173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a father's brother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of an uncle</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): patruae verbera linguae, <hi rend="ital">an uncle's</hi>, Hor C. 3, 12, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">ense cadit patruo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:55" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 55</bibl></cit> (al. patrui).—Comically in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrue mi patruissime,</quote> <trans><tr>my uncle</tr>, <tr>my best of uncles!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
patulcianus: <entryFree id="n34174" type="main" key="Pa^tulci^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătulcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Patulcius, II.</entryFree>
patulcius: <entryFree id="n34175" type="main" key="Pa^tulci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătulcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pateo, standing open</etym>. <sense id="n34175.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of Janus</hi>, because in time of war his temple stood open (opp. Clusius, q. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:129" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 129</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 129</bibl>. This epithet was also applied to Jupiter and Juno, Inscr. Spon. Miscell. Ant. p. 81.—</sense><sense id="n34175.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman quœstor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a debtor of Cicero;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pătulcĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Patulcius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Patulcianum,</quote> <trans><tr>the debt of Patulcius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
patulus: <entryFree id="n34176" type="main" key="pa^tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pătŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pateo</etym>, <sense id="n34176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">standing open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi> (syn. patens). </sense><sense id="n34176.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus patulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=161" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 161</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">pina duabus grandibus patula conchis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patulae aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavo aut patulo maxime ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 752</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34176.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spreading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patulis captavit naribus auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canistra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 676</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patulae in latitudinem naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 9, 14, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves alis patulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:6:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patulos boves,</quote> <trans><tr>broadhorned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=221" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 221</bibl></cit> Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n34176.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">open to all</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patulus orbis,</quote> <trans><tr>the beaten round</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 132</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PAUC" /></sense></entryFree>
pauci: <entryFree id="n34177" type="main" key="pauci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pauci</orth>, v. paucus, II. A.</entryFree>
paucies: <entryFree id="n34178" type="main" key="pauci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paucĭes</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">paucĭens</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>paucus</etym>, <sense id="n34178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a few times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seldom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rarely</hi> (ante-class.): tuam uxorem pauciens video, Titin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=220" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 220</bibl> Müll. and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 157, 17</bibl>: in urbem paucies venire, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 157, 18</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 157, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pauciloquium: <entryFree id="n34179" type="hapax" key="pauci^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paucĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>paucus-lo quor</etym>, <sense id="n34179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speaking but little</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paucitas: <entryFree id="n34180" type="main" key="pauci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paucĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>paucus</etym>, <sense id="n34180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fewness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarcity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paucity</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quanta oratorum sit semperque fuerit paucitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summā paucitate amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucitatem militum Caesaris despiciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res et paucitatem eorum insignem et multitudinem Etruscorum . . . faciebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 50, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia paucitas suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—Without a <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: de pantheris agitur mandatu meo diligenter; <cit><quote lang="la">sed mira paucitas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:22:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 22, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pauculus: <entryFree id="n34181" type="main" key="paucu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paucŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n34181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">very few</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very little</hi> (mostly ante- and postclass., and commonly in <number>plur.</number>): inter pauculos amicos, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Anton. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Anton. 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mane, paucula etiam sciscitare prius volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo te verbis pauculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquitor paucula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diebus pauculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ibi pauculos dies esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare dereliquisti pauculas oves istas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:17:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 17, 28</bibl></cit>.— In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">post pauculum tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 272, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paucus: <entryFree id="n34182" type="main" key="paucus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paucus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<sense id="n34182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> paucūm, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">fin.—Dat. plur. fem.</hi> paucabus, Cn. Gellius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 39</bibl> P.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root pau-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pau/w</foreign>, to cause to cease, <foreign lang="greek">pau=la</foreign>, remnant, <foreign lang="greek">pau=ros</foreign>, little; cf. paulus, pauper, parvus (<foreign lang="greek">pau=ros</foreign>）</etym>, <hi rend="ital">few</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi> (the <number>sing.</number> very rare; cf.: parvus, exiguus, rarus): verbūm Paucūm, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 252 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">in diebus paucis Chrysis moritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis diebus post mortem Africani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">his paucis diebus,</quote> <trans><tr>a few days ago</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 168</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:35:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 35, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae modicae et paucae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:32:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 32, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci admodum familiares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucorum hominum et mentis bene sanae (i. e. paucis hominibus familiariter utens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 19</bibl> and v. Ruhnk. ad h. l. Lycurgus <foreign lang="greek">ge/rontas</foreign> Lacedaemone appellavit, nimis is quidem paucos, XXVIII., quos, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:28:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 28, 50</bibl>: nimium fortasse pauci viverent, Lact. Ira Dei, 20, 5.— <hi rend="ital">Comp</hi> ne pauciores cum pluribus manum consererent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 2</bibl>. pauciora navigia, Auct. B. Afr.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam paucissimae plagae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34182.1" n="(b)" level="5"> In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia tenuis simplexque foramine pauco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias pauco aere diluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:31" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 31</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34182.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n34182.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pauci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">few</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a few</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut metus ad omnes, poena ad paucos perveniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 46, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci sciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumnia paucorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucorum potentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 39, 1</bibl></cit>; 20, 7.—Sometimes pauci is used in the sense of <hi rend="ital">the few</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the select few</hi> (opp. multi, the many, the multitude): non paucis . . . ac sapientibus esse probatum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 519, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucorum judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum qui pauci nominantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: pauciores, <hi rend="ital">the more distinguished</hi> (opp. plures), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 12</bibl>.—Hence, inter paucos (paucas), in paucis, adverb., with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinarily</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis pugna atque inter paucas memorata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna memorabilis inter paucas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">situs inter paucas munitae urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Florus, inter paucos disertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hector, in paucis Alexandro carus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:8:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regi carus in paucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in paucis digna res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:45" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 7, 28, § 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34182.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pauca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a few words</hi>: philosophandum est paucis, nam omnino haut placet, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:15:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 15, 9</bibl> (Trag. v. 417 Vahl.): pauca sunt, tecum quae volo, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 214</bibl> P.: audite, pueri, pauca, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 403, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pauca confer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis me misit ad eam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cb n="PAUL" /> paucis rem attingere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ausculta paucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis te volo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis docebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauca refert,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauca respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi pauca velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:107" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera quam paucissimis absolvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paulatim: <entryFree id="n34183" type="main" key="paula_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paulātim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">paull-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>paulum</etym>, <sense id="n34183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by little and little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by degrees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gradually</hi> (syn. sensim). </sense><sense id="n34183.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">labefacto paulatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim Germanos consuescere Rhenum transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis leviter fastigatus paulatim ad planitiem redibat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi paulatim licentia crevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim adnabam terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:83" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia exuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:188" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 188</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34183.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of the succession of parts one after the other, <hi rend="ital">a few</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a little at a time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim ex castris discedere coeperunt, non omnes simul, sed subinde pauci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:47" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 47</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae paulatim addito,</quote> <trans><tr>add water a little at a time</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paulianus: <entryFree id="n34184" type="main" key="Pauli^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paulĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Paull-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Paulus, A.</entryFree>
paulinus: <entryFree id="n34185" type="main" key="Pauli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paulīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Paull-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Paulus, B.</entryFree>
paulisper: <entryFree id="n34186" type="main" key="paulisper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paulisper</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">paull-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>paulumper</etym>, <sense id="n34186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">for a little while</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for a short time</hi> (cf. parumper): <cit><quote lang="la">quasi solstitialis herba, paulisper fui: Repente exortus sum, repentino occidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper mane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper tace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectica paulisper deposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper intermittere proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34186.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">donec</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Milo paulisper, dum se uxor, ut fit, comparat, commoratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedit tacitus paulisper, donec nuntiatum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
paulo: <entryFree id="n34187" type="main" key="paulo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paulō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">paull-</orth>), <case>abl.</case>, v. 1. paulus.</entryFree>
paululatim: <entryFree id="n34188" type="main" key="paulu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paulŭlātim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">paull-</orth>), <sense id="n34188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. dim.</hi> [paululus], <hi rend="ital">by little and little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by degrees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gradually</hi> (Appul.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 121, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>, p. 167, 26.</sense></entryFree>
paululo: <entryFree id="n34189" type="main" key="paulu^lo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paulŭlō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">paull-</orth>), <case>abl.</case>, v. paululus.</entryFree>
paululum: <entryFree id="n34190" type="main" key="paulu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paulŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">paull-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. paululus <sense id="n34190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
paululus: <entryFree id="n34191" type="main" key="paulu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paulŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">paull-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n34191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. paulus], <hi rend="ital">very little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very small</hi> (most freq. in <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> and adverb.): <cit><quote lang="la">pila,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de paulo paululum hoc tibi dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">da mihi paululum bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:24:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 24, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Judic. 4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi hominesque paululi et graciles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admixto paululo sale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34191.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">paulŭ-lum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a little bit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trifle.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paululum praedae feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paululum pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil aut admodum paululum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paululum ad beatam vitam deesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:8:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in <case>abl.</case>: paululo, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nequeas paululo, at quanti queas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: valeo, sicut soleo: paululo tamen etiam deterius quam soleo, Lucc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 1</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">paulŭlum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a very little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abscede paululum istuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: concede istuc paululum; <cit><quote lang="la">audin'?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paululum opperirier si vis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paululum respirare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente paululum inminutā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 65:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 65, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 61, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si paululum intermissa fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paululum tempore nostro superiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paulum: <entryFree id="n34192" type="main" key="paulum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paulum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">paull-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. paulus <sense id="n34192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
paulus: <entryFree id="n34193" type="main" key="paulus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paulus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">paull-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for paurulus; Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">pau=ros</foreign>; cf. misellus for miserulus</etym>. <sense id="n34193.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi> (anteclass. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">paulo momento huc vel illuc impelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo sumptu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauper a paulo lare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=92" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 92</bibl></cit> Müll.: paula trua, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 19, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34193.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pau-lum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trifle</hi>: de paulo paululum<pb n="1318" /> <cb n="PAUP" />  hoc tibi dabo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi vero paulum intersiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an paulum hoc esse tibi videtur?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 8, 38: agelli paulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicī,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">negotī,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum huic Cottae tribuit partium,</quote> <trans><tr>allotted a small part of his defence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil Aut paulum abstulerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi paulum nescio quid superest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 47</bibl></cit>: post paulum, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>. —</sense><sense id="n34193.2" n="II" level="1"> Adverb. uses. </sense><sense id="n34193.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">paulo</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34193.4" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo prius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberius paulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 24, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civis haud paulo melior, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo secus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:30:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud paulo plus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo minus consideratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo magis affabre factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis paulo magis priscis uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo longius processerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturius paulo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo minus quatuordecim annos,</quote> <trans><tr>a little under</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo minus, quam privatum egit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo minus octogesimo aetatis anno decessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo minus quinque millia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:28:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 28, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34193.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp. with <hi rend="ital">ante</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae paulo ante praecepta dedimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 39, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:227" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:114" default="NO">9, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post paulo,</quote> <trans><tr>just after</tr>, <tr>a little after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 60</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n34193.6" n="3" level="3"> With words and expressions implying superiority or comparison: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudine paulo antecedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba paulo nimium redundantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">histrio si paulo se movit extra numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo ultra eum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo mox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 268</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34193.7" n="4" level="3"> Without comparison (rare), <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo qui est homo tolerabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non solum gloriosis consiliis utamur, sed etiam paulo salubribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut nihil aut paulo cui tum concedere digna, Lux mea, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 131</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34193.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">paulum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum supra eum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolae me paulum recreant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum differre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">requiescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:62:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commorari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: scaphae paulum progressae, Sall. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:26:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 26, 10</bibl> (Hist. 1, 60 Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">paulum aspectu conterritus haesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 597</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34193.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adv. of time</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post paulum,</quote> <trans><tr>a little later</tr>, <tr>after a short time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:25" default="NO">2, 17, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:148" default="NO">11, 3, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra paulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infra jugulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl></cit>; cf. also: paulum praelabitur ante, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 43, 111.—</sense><sense id="n34193.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud paulum major,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:21" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:938" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 938</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34194" type="main" key="Paulus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Paulus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Paull-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi> (not a praenomen; cf. Borghesi Framm. de' Fasti Cons. i. p. 49, and his Dec. Numism. 4, n. 10) <hi rend="ital">of the Æmilian family</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:6:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 6, § 14</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n34194.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Aemilius Paulus, <hi rend="ital">a consul who fell in the battle near Cannœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 20, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:33:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 33, 71</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n34194.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of no. I.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the adoptive father of the younger Scipio and the conqueror of Perseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 15</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n34194.3" n="III" level="1"> Q. Paulus Fabius Maximus, <hi rend="ital">a consul</hi> A. U. C. 743, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 100" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34194.4" n="IV" level="1"> Julius Paulus, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated jurist under Alexander Severus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colleague of Papinian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34194.5" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Paul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Christian name of Saul of Tarsus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the apostle to the Gentiles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of many epistles to the Churches</hi>, Vulg. Act. passim.—</sense><sense id="n34194.6" n="VI" level="1"> Sergius Paulus, <hi rend="ital">proconsul in Cyprus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 13, 7</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n34194.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Paulĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Paulus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Paulian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pauliana victoria,</quote> <trans><tr>the victory of L. Æmilius Paulus over Perseus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:11:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: Pauliana responsa, <hi rend="ital">of the jurist J. Paulus</hi>, Dig. praef. ad Antecess. § 5.—</sense><sense id="n34194.8" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Paulī-nus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Paull-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Paulus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pauline</hi>, only as a Roman surname.—<pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n34194.9" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Paulīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Suetonius Paulinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34194.10" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Paulīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lollia Paulina,</quote> <trans><tr>wife of the emperor Caligula</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pauper: <entryFree id="n34195" type="main" key="pauper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pauper</orth>, <itype>pĕris</itype> (<sense id="n34195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> paupera, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 519</bibl>, called obsolete by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 77</bibl> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> <cb n="PAUP" /> pauperum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:33" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 33</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi> pauperorum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 46</bibl> dub.; Inscr. ex Ann. p. Chr. n. 341: AMATOR PAVPERORVM, ap. Fea, Framm. de' Fasti Cons. p. 90), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">pau-</foreign> of <foreign lang="greek">pau=ros</foreign> (cf. paucus, etc.), and per- of pario, pe-per-i, producing little</etym>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not wealthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of small means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has only enough for his moderate expenses</hi> (cf.: indigus, egenus, inops).—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauper, cui opera vita erat, ruri fere Se continebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (judices) saepe propter invidiam adimunt diviti, Aut propter misericordiam addunt pauperi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optavit honeste in patriā pauper vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus domini pauperis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sisne ex pauperrimo dives factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si abundans opibus pauperem se vocet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Aeque pauperibus prodest, locupletibus aeque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo sum pauper in aere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34195.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum Semper ego optarim pauperrimus esse bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauper Opimius argenti positi intus et auri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 30, 11</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pauper</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a poor man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperum tabernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperum cenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperum sepulcra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperiorum turbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34195.2" n="2" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scanty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose).—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperes res inopesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit> (19): <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperis tuguri culmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et carmen venā pauperiore fluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauper pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina pauperis aevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauper sulci cerealis Abella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:545" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 545</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: exemplis pauperior, App. Flor. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n34195.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for egenus, <hi rend="ital">needy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indigent</hi>: homo Pauper, qui educit in egestate liberos, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopes ac pauperes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34195.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>, intellectually (very rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">miser, misellus): miser enim et (ut ita dicam) pauper orator est, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. § 28.—</sense><sense id="n34195.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Pauperes spiritu, i. e. <hi rend="ital">humble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 5, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">poorly;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperius incedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
pauperasco: <entryFree id="n34196" type="main" key="pauperasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pauperasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n34196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi> [pauper], <hi rend="ital">to grow poor</hi> (late Lat.), Falg. Rusp. Serm. 5, 6.</sense></entryFree>
pauperculus: <entryFree id="n34197" type="main" key="paupercu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paupercŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n34197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">poor</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumus pauperculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">res nostrae sunt, pater, pauperculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pauperies: <entryFree id="n34198" type="main" key="paupe^ri^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paupĕrĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">poverty</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose for the class. paupertas). </sense><sense id="n34198.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: quod in pauperie meā senex graviter gemam, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 494, 5</bibl> (Trag. v. 236 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">erum intulit in pauperiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit> (al. inpulit); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperiem et duros perferre labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustam pauperiem pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immunda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">importuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 20, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixit in summā pauperie et paene inopiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impoenitendae pauperiei se committere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 271, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. paupertas.—</sense><sense id="n34198.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">injury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loss</hi>, which one suffers from an animal (perh. mentioned in the Twelve Tables): <cit><quote lang="la">si quadrupes pauperiem fecisse dicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9</bibl></cit>, tit. 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperies est damnum sine injuriā facientis datum: nec enim potest animal injuriam fecisse, quod sensu caret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pauperius: <entryFree id="n34199" type="main" key="paupe^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paupĕrĭus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pauper <sense id="n34199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
paupero: <entryFree id="n34200" type="main" key="paupe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paupĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pauper</etym>, <sense id="n34200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to impoverish</hi> (ante- and post-class., and once in Hor.). </sense><sense id="n34200.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni viri me pauperant, improbi alunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 27</bibl></cit>; Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 157, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defectio civium pauperatorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34200.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: aliquem aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to rob</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deprive one of any thing</hi> (= spoliare, privare): quam ego tantā pauperavi per dolum pecuniā, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 157, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominum pretio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 134</bibl></cit>: aliquem cassā nuce, Hor. S. <cb n="PAUS" /> 2, 5, 36: luna pauperata luminibus, Firm. Math. 1, 2.</sense></entryFree>
paupertas: <entryFree id="n34201" type="main" key="paupertas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paupertas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pauper</etym>, <sense id="n34201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">poverty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderate circumstances</hi> (opp. as well to egestas, inopia, penuria, as to abundantia and luxuria, v. Doed. Syn. 3, pp. 111 and 118; class.) </sense><sense id="n34201.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: pecuniaque erat parva; ab eo paupertas dicta, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 43, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non video quid aliud sit paupertas quam parvi possessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non est paupertas, Nestor, habere nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:32:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 32, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas est non quae pauca possidet, sed quae multa non possidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Scaev.</author> Dig. 36, 1, 78, § 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertatem eri tolerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertatem vel potius egestatem ac mendicitatem ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:1:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:23:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 23, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de paupertate agitur: multi patientes pauperes commemorantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homines . . . patientiā paupertatis ornati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:24:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 24, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me mea paupertas vitae traducat inerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit> (5): <cit><quote lang="la">casta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:609" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 609</bibl></cit>:-paupertatem inopiā mutare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbantur illis temporibus in magnā paupertate satis idoneae istae pecuniae poenae esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:223" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 223</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34201.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: potes animo advertere et horum temporum divitias et illorum paupertates, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 162, 20</bibl> (nove positum numero plurali, Non.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex multis paupertatibus divitiae flunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34201.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for egestas, inopia, <hi rend="ital">need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indigence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum propter paupertatem sues puer pasceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 17, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:152" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 152</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34201.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">poverty</hi> of language (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">paupertate sermonis laboramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:34" default="NO">12, 10, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:4" default="NO">2, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
paupertatula: <entryFree id="n34202" type="main" key="pauperta_tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paupertātŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>paupertas</etym>, <sense id="n34202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">poverty</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 127</bibl>, n. 14.</sense></entryFree>
paupertinus: <entryFree id="n34203" type="main" key="pauperti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paupertīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pauper</etym>, <sense id="n34203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorry</hi> (ante- and post-class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 162, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:30" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 135, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contubernia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34203.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 8</bibl></cit> (al. 14).</sense></entryFree>
pausa: <entryFree id="n34204" type="greek" key="pausa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pausa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pau=sis</foreign> [root in <foreign lang="greek">pau/w</foreign>, to cause to cease, to stop], <sense id="n34204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">halt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cessation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi> (ante- and post-class. for quies, finis, etc.): Neptunus saevus undis asperis pausam dedit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Sat. v. 11 Vahl.): pausam facere ore fremendi, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=104" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 104</bibl> (Ann. v. 572 ib.); cf.: quae pausa pugnandi fieret, id. ap. Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 188</bibl> (Ann. v. 348 ib.): pausam dare loquendi, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 158, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 158:8" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 158, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pausam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">da pausam, parce misero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:930" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 930</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare pausam conciliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pausam stare fragori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 747</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pausa parva fit ardoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibendae nivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pausam pacemque tribuere saevis casibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 357, 40</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 150</bibl>, the true read. is <foreign lang="greek">pau=sai</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n34204.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in the later relig. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">pausas edere, in the processions of Isis,</quote> <trans><tr>to stop at certain stations and sing hymns in honor of the goddess</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Caracall. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pausas explere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pescen. 6</bibl></cit>; cf. pausarius, II.</sense></entryFree>
pausabilis: <entryFree id="n34205" type="main" key="pausa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pausābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pauso</etym>, <sense id="n34205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that sometimes ceases</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pausabilior inspiratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:150" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 150</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pausanias: <entryFree id="n34206" type="main" key="Pausa^ni^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pausănĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pausani/as</foreign>. <sense id="n34206.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Cleombrotus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the leader of the Spartans in the battle of Platœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Vit. Paus. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Vit. Paus. 1</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n34206.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A prince of Pherœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34206.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A prœtor of the Epirotes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34206.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Macedonian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the murderer of Philip</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:6:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1 al" default="NO">7, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
