pausarius: <entryFree id="n34207" type="main" key="pausa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pausārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pausa</etym>. <sense id="n34207.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A commander of the rowers</hi>, who with a hammer gave them the signal when to stop, <hi rend="ital">a rowing-master</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 5</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 618</bibl>, and v. hortator and portisculus).—</sense><sense id="n34207.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pau-sārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the priests of Isis</hi>, who made processions in honor of the goddess, Inscr. Rein. cl. 1, n. 139 dub. (Rein. and Marin. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Frat. Arv. p. 249" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Frat. Arv. p. 249</bibl>, instead of CORPORA PAVSARIORVM, read CORPORATI AVRARIORVM).</sense></entryFree>
pausate: <entryFree id="n34208" type="main" key="pausa_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pausātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pauso, <sense id="n34208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pausatio: <entryFree id="n34209" type="main" key="pausa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pausātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pauso</etym>, <sense id="n34209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a halting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pausing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pausatio spiritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 28</bibl></cit>, n. 2: POST NOSTRAM PAVSATIONEM,<pb n="1319" /> <cb n="PAVA" />  i. e. <hi rend="ital">after our death</hi>, Inscr. (ex Ann. p. Chr. n. 359) Murat. 381, 1.</sense></entryFree>
pausatus: <entryFree id="n34210" type="main" key="pausa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pausātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pauso.</entryFree>
pausea: <entryFree id="n34211" type="main" key="pause^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pausĕa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">pōsĕa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pōsĭa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pau-sĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n34211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of olive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which yielded an excellent oil</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:60" default="NO">1, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:1" default="NO">12, 47, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 2, 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pausias: <entryFree id="n34212" type="main" key="Pausi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pausĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pausi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n34212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated painter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Sicyon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Apelles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 2, 3, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:126" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11, 40, § 126</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pausĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Pausias</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pausillulus:
<entryFree id="n34213" type="main" key="pausillu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pausillŭlus</orth>, v. pauxillulus <sense id="n34213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">pausĭlȳpon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pausi/lupon</foreign> (ending pain), <hi rend="ital">a tomb</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 750</bibl>, n. 573.</sense></entryFree>
pausilypum: <entryFree id="n34214" type="main" key="Pausi^ly_pum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pausĭlȳpum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pausi/lupon</foreign>, <sense id="n34214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain between Naples and Puteoli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which projects into the sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Hill of Posilipo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:167" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 53, 78, § 167</bibl>. <hi rend="ital">There Vedius Pollio had a villa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which he left to Augustus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and which was afterwards possessed by the emperor Trajan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 199</bibl>, n. 486.</sense></entryFree>
pausistratus: <entryFree id="n34215" type="main" key="Pausistra^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pausistrătus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pausi/stratos</foreign>, <sense id="n34215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a general of Rhodes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:45" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pauso: <entryFree id="n34216" type="main" key="pauso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pauso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>pausa</etym>. <sense id="n34216.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to halt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pause</hi> (ante- and postclass. for quiesco, interquiesco): <cit><quote lang="la">cum capitis pausaverit dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:16" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pausante vomitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:21:212" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 3, 21, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pausa et quiesce, populus meus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 4</bibl></cit> Esdr. 2, 24 (for <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 150</bibl>, v. pausa).—</sense><sense id="n34216.1" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to rest</hi> in the grave, = requiescere (late Lat.): PAVSAT IN PACE, Inscr. Boldetti Cimeter. p. 399; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Gall. Antiqu. p. 55</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pausātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">that has halted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">paused; at rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resting</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">jumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sauciat pectus pausatae circa arboris robur (i. e. quiescentis in antro),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 160</bibl></cit> dub. (al. pausate).</sense></entryFree>
pausus: <entryFree id="n34217" type="main" key="Pausus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pausus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god of rest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pauxillatim: <entryFree id="n34218" type="main" key="pauxilla_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pauxillātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>pauxillus</etym>, = paulatim, <sense id="n34218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by little and little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by degrees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gradually</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem pauxillatim accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pauxillisper: <entryFree id="n34219" type="hapax" key="pauxillisper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pauxillisper</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by little bits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by degrees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus decem pondo amoris pauxillisper perdidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 21</bibl></cit> (id est per particulas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 156, 2</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
pauxillitas: <entryFree id="n34220" type="main" key="pauxilli^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pauxillĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diminutiveness</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Hex. 6, 9, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pauxillo: <entryFree id="n34221" type="main" key="pauxillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pauxillo</orth>, v. pauxillus.</entryFree>
pauxillulum: <entryFree id="n34222" type="main" key="pauxillu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pauxillŭlum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pauxillulus.</entryFree>
pauxillulus: <entryFree id="n34223" type="main" key="pauxillu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pauxillŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pausill-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n34223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [pauxillus], <hi rend="ital">very little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very small</hi> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in libello hoc obsignato ad te attuli pauxillulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lembus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 24</bibl></cit> Fleck. (al. pauxillulum): admonitiones, Gell. N. A. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n34223.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pauxil-lŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pausill-</orth>), <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tuis deliciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 48</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquom pauxillulum nummorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pauxillŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pausill-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc forem pausillulum aperi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pauxillum: <entryFree id="n34224" type="main" key="pauxillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pauxillum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pauxillus.</entryFree>
pauxillus: <entryFree id="n34225" type="main" key="pauxillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pauxillus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pausill-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n34225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [paucus], <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi> (mostly ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: peccatum, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 363, 15</bibl> (al. pausillulum): <cit><quote lang="la">ossa pauxilla atque minuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:836" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 836</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 229</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34225.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pauxillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex pauxillo,</quote> <trans><tr>little by little</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">da mihi pauxillum aquae ad bibendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:24:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 24, 43</bibl></cit>.—Esp. <case>abl.</case>: pauxillo, <hi rend="ital">by a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>: pauxillo prius me convenit, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 191</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">pauxillo levius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28</bibl></cit>, n. 18.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pauxillum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed si pauxillum potes contentus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut pausillum differat a caulibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauxillum manus conseres, ut conquiescas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:24:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 24, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pava: <entryFree id="n34226" type="main" key="pa_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pavus for pavo</etym>, <sense id="n34226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peahen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 69</bibl>; cf. 1. pavo <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> <cb n="PAVI" /></sense></entryFree>
pavefacio: <entryFree id="n34227" type="main" key="pa^ve^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvĕ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>paveo</etym>, <sense id="n34227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to frighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrify</hi> (very rare): pavefacio, <foreign lang="greek">deilopoiw=</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:878" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 878</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavefacta pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:636" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 636</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito pavefactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:99" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumo ac murmure pavefactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:20" default="NO">5, 14, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavefactus infans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1022" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1022</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgente ejus lumine pavefactus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118, 8, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavefecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Qu. in Heptat. 7:27" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Qu. in Heptat. 7, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
paventia: <entryFree id="n34228" type="main" key="Pa^venti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Păventĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess who guarded children against sudden terrors</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 11.</sense></entryFree>
paveo: <entryFree id="n34229" type="main" key="pa^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvĕo</orth>, <itype>pāvi</itype> (<sense id="n34229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. pres. gen. plur.</hi> paventūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 412</bibl>), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [etym. dub.; perh. akin with pavio]. </sense><sense id="n34229.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be struck with fear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tremble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quake with fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be afraid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be terrified</hi> (perh. not used by Cic.; not in Cæs.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: tremo, trepido, timeo, metuo): nam et intus paveo et foris formido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi paveo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne pave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeres, quando iterum paveas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paventes ad omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 42, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente Maurus incerto vultu pavens ad Sullam accurrit,</quote> <trans><tr>in great fear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">admiratione paventibus cunctis,</quote> <trans><tr>seized with astonishment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 34, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">speque metuque pavent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:362" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alieno discrimine sibi pavens, ne adlevasse videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">venae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sermone pavent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>express their fears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:189" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 189</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pavete ad sanctuarium meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 26, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 31, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavens pro arcā Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Reg. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavebit a facie consilii Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 19, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 30, 31</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">31, 4: super quo pavet anima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:24:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 24, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34229.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be terrified at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et illud paveo et hoc formido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 59</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with a general object: ad hoc mulieres . . . miserari parvos liberos, rogitare, omnia pavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 3</bibl></cit>: noctem paventes, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis Parthum paveat, quis gelidum Scythen?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pavet acres Agna lupos capreaeque leones!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristiorem casum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saturam serpentibus ibin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:3" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 12, 9, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Castanea) pavet novitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 34, § 149</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 104</bibl>, read batuerentur): <cit><quote lang="la">nec pedibus tantum pavendas serpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 23, 35, § 85</bibl></cit>.—Perh. here too belongs: paveri frumenta dicebant antiqui, quae de vaginā non bene exibant, Fest. p 251 and 253 Müll.; v. Müll. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n34229.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pavetque Laedere jactatis maternas ossibus umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec illae numerare aut exigere plagas pavent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pavesco: <entryFree id="n34230" type="main" key="pa^vesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n34230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [paveo] (mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n34230.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to be afraid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become alarmed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni strepitu pavescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 72:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 72, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ejusmodi tactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nocturnas imagines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 20, § 67</bibl></cit> (al. expavescere): <cit><quote lang="la">pavescere sensim et quasi albescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34230.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to fear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to be alarmed at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigia deūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:127" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pavibundus: <entryFree id="n34231" type="main" key="pa^vi^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvĭbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">trepidationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 221</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pavicula: <entryFree id="n34232" type="main" key="pa^vi_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pavio</etym>, <sense id="n34232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rammer</hi>: paviculae, <foreign lang="greek">o(malisth=res</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO">12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:1" default="NO">2, 20, 1</bibl>; 11, 3, 34.</sense></entryFree>
paviculo: <entryFree id="n34233" type="gloss" key="pa^vi_cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvīcŭlo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">păvīclo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pavicula</etym>, <sense id="n34233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beat down</hi>: paviclat, <foreign lang="greek">podi/zei, e)dafi/zei</foreign>, Gloss. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
pavide: <entryFree id="n34234" type="main" key="pa^vi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pavidus <sense id="n34234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pavidus: <entryFree id="n34235" type="main" key="pa^vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>paveo</etym>, <sense id="n34235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alarmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timorous</hi> (perhaps not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n34235.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">timida atque pavida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:973" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 973</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris se pavidus tenebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 489</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavidus semper atque anxius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:35" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:400" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavida ex somno mulier,</quote> <trans><tr>startled out of her sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnes suspiciones pavidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidani pavidi, ne jam facta in urbem via esset, fossam ducere instituunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: quos pavidiores accepimus,<cb n="PAVO" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 144</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra mens pavidissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:16:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 16, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:65" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34235.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nandi pavidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensionum non pavidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:811" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 811</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 293" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1076" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1076</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34235.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Carthalo non pavidus fetas mulcere leaenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:406" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 406</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34235.4" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> adverbially: <cit><quote lang="la">pavidum blandita,</quote> <trans><tr>with fear</tr>, <tr>timorously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 568</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34235.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34235.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Accompanied with fear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anxiety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavidum murmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:133" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies pavida imaginibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n34235.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That produces fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreadful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:567" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 567</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">păvĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timorously</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">timefactae religiones effugiunt animo pavide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pavimentarius: <entryFree id="n34236" type="gloss" key="pa^vi_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvīmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pavimentum</etym>, <sense id="n34236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of pavements</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pavior</hi>, Inscr. Don. cl. 9, n. 35; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 527, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pavimento: <entryFree id="n34237" type="main" key="pa^vi^mento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvĭmento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n34237.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cover with a pavement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus pavimentata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:44:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 44, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34237.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make a pavement</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 5, § 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pavimentum: <entryFree id="n34238" type="main" key="pa^vi_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pavio</etym>, <sense id="n34238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a floor</hi> composed of small stones, earth, or lime, <hi rend="ital">beaten down with a rammer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hard floor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pavement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi de testā aridā pavimentum struito: ubi structum erit pavito fricatoque oleo, uti pavimentum bonum siet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:51" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenta Poenica marmore Numidico constrata significat Cato, cum ait, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mero Tingere pavimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenta fistucis pavita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 61, § 185</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 105</bibl>.—Also, of the covering of a roof, <hi rend="ital">tiling</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 1.</sense></entryFree>
pavio: <entryFree id="n34239" type="main" key="pa^vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">paiw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n34239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34239.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavit aequor harenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex ore pavire terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:34:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 34, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34239.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ram</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tread down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aream esse oportet solidam, terrā pavitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:51:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sato pavitur terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 7, 36, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenta fistucis pavita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 25, 61, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavitum solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">păvītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a hard-beaten floor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pavement</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 25, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pavitatio: <entryFree id="n34240" type="main" key="pa^vi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pavito</etym>, <sense id="n34240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quaking</hi> (post-class.), App. de Mundo, p. 65, 31.</sense></entryFree>
pavitensis: <entryFree id="n34241" type="main" key="pa^vi_tensi_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvītensīs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pavio</etym>, <sense id="n34241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beaten close</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis (opp. levidensis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 22, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pavito: <entryFree id="n34242" type="main" key="pa^vi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n34242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [paveo]. </sense><sense id="n34242.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to tremble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quake with fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be very fearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be greatly afraid; to tremble at</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quae pueri in tenebris pavitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosequitur pavitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effusis pavitantem fletibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:410" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavitante gressu sequere fallaces vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oed. 1047" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oed. 1047</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34242.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to shake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shiver with the ague</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have the ague</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pavitum: <entryFree id="n34243" type="main" key="pa^vi_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. pavio <sense id="n34243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pavo: <entryFree id="n34244" type="main" key="pa_vo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāvo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (ante-class. and late collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pāvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 75</bibl> P., or Ann. v. 15 Vahl.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 215</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 20, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 10, 22</bibl>; whence <sense id="n34244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> pava, q. v.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">taw/s</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a peacock</hi>, sacred to Juno, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=75" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 75</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 20, 22, § 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda pavoni donata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 806</bibl>.—As a delicacy, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 20</bibl>.—The male, for the sake of distinction, is called masculus pavo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and the female, femina pavo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:16:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.—From the tails of peacocks fly-flaps were made; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:67" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 67</bibl>, and v. pavoninus.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34245" type="main" key="Pa_vo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pāvo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fircellius Pavo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pavonaceus: <entryFree id="n34246" type="hapax" key="pa_vo_na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāvōnācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. pavo</etym>, <sense id="n34246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a peacock;</hi> transf., <hi rend="ital">like a peacock's tail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variegated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 44, § 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pavoninus: <entryFree id="n34247" type="main" key="pa_vo_ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāvōnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a peacock.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34247.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova pavonina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1320" /> <cb n="PAX" /> 13: <cit><quote lang="la">muscaria,</quote> <trans><tr>fly-flaps made of peacocks' tails</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:67" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 67</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n34247.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">colored like a peacock's tail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pavonine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus pavoninus,</quote> <trans><tr>a couch of citron-wood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:85" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 85</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pavor: <entryFree id="n34248" type="main" key="pa^vor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">păvor</orth> (old <case>nom.</case> pavos, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 487, 8</bibl>; Fragm. Trag. 45 Rib.; Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 155</bibl>; Fragm. Trag. v. 82 Rib.; B. and K. read pavor), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>paveo</etym>, <sense id="n34248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throbbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">panting</hi> with fear, desire, joy, etc., <hi rend="ital">anxiety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alarm</hi>, etc. (perh. not used by Cic.; syn.: metus, timor, tremor): pavorem, metum mentem loco moventem; <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo illud Enni: tum pavor sapientiam omnem mi exanimato expectorat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit> (this verse of Ennius is also cited in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 154</bibl>; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 96</bibl> Vahl., and Trag. Rel. p. 17 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">hic exsultat enim pavor ac metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:13:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus terror pavorque omnes occupavit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavor ceperat milites ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavorem inicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 331</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavorem deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 732</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:77" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 77</bibl></cit>.—Of expectant or joyful trembling: <cit><quote lang="la">cum spes arrectae juvenum, exsultantiaque haurit Corda pavor pulsans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 138</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeto pavore proditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:432" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 432</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">religious fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:691" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 691</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavor aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>dread of water</tr>, <tr>hydrophobia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:98" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 5, 32, § 98</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 2</bibl>, aquae timor; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(drofobi/a</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n34248.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venia est tantorum danda pavorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 521</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:147" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra formidines pavoresque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 29, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repentini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 10, 48, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34248.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Păvor</orth>, <itype>personified</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the god of fear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:799" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 799</bibl>; v. pallor <hi rend="ital">fin.—His priests</hi> are called Pavorii, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 285</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pavus: <entryFree id="n34249" type="main" key="pa_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pāvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. pavo <sense id="n34249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pax: <entryFree id="n34250" type="main" key="pax1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pax</orth>, <itype>pācis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from the root pac, pag, pacisco, pango; <cit><quote lang="la">whence also pagina, pagus, q. v.: pacem a pactione conditionum putat dictam Sinnius Capito, quae utrique inter se populo sit observanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=230" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 230</bibl></cit> Müll.; orig. an agreement, contract, treaty; hence</etym>, <sense id="n34250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">peace</hi>, concluded between parties at variance, esp. between belligerents; <hi rend="ital">a treaty of peace; tranquillity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the absence of war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reconciliation</hi> after a quarrel, public or private (cf. indutiae): <cit><quote lang="la">quando ita rem gessistis . . . Pax conmerciumque'st vobis mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem componi volo Meo patre cum matri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 113</bibl></cit>: orator sine pace redit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=41" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 41</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 211 Vahl.): pacem inter sese conciliant, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 25, 39</bibl> (Trag. v. 164 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">videndum est cum omnibusne pax esse possit, an sit aliquod bellum inexpiabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax est tranquilla libertas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 44, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam populare quam pax, tranquillitas, otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:37:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 37, 102</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse pacem alicui cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 8, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciliare inter cives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conficere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coagmentare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confirmare cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pace uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimittere aliquem cum pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 15, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipienda bella sunt . . . ut sine injuriā in pace vivatur (cf. II. 2. infra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem L. Sulla, cum bellum invexisset totam in Asiam, cum pace dimisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 15, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pangere cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis bona cum pace accepta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque pax populo Caeriti data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bocchus neque bello neque pace antea cognitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem agitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sumptā et positā pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:36" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem turbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">additis qui pacem nostram metuebant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the peace granted by us</tr>.</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 29: pace belloque rempublicam regere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello ac pace,</quote> <trans><tr>both in war and in peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:839" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 839</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediā pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediā pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in intimo sinu pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alta pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 576" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 576</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34250.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostibus victis, pacibus perfectis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 149, 15</bibl>: jura, <cb n="PECC" /> judicia, bella atque paces penes paucos erant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 102</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1230</bibl>, ventorum paces is spurious; v. Lachm.).—</sense><sense id="n34250.2" n="2" level="3"> Personified: <cit><quote lang="la">Pax,</quote> <trans><tr>the goddess of peace</tr>, <tr>Peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:709 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 709 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 882</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:57" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:124" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1823</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34250.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n34250.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Grace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pardon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi> of the gods: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem ab Aesculapio petas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis supremi multis hostiis pacem expetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt hic omnia quae ad deūm pacem oportet adesse? (sc. expetundam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divum, pacem votis adit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Jove Opt. Max. pacem ac veniam peto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis deūm exposcendae causā lectisternium fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exorat pacem divom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 370</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 535</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34250.5" n="2" level="3"> Pace tuā, alicujus, <hi rend="ital">with your</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">his</hi>) <hi rend="ital">good leave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">permission</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pace quod fiat tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pace tuā dixerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:17:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 17, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Claudi pace loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 19, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pace majestatis ejus dixerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:129:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 129, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pace diligentiae Catonis dixerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:7:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pace loquar Veneris: tu dea major eris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34250.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dominion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empire</hi>, of the Romans (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pax Romana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tot milia gladiorum, quae pax mea (i. e. Neronis) comprimit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa Romanae pacis majestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 33</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n34250.7" n="4" level="3"> Pax, as an interj., <hi rend="ital">peace! silence! enough!</hi> pax, abi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 213</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:7:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 7, 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus passus, prolixus, circum caput Rejectus neglegenter: pax!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n34250.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">peace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ease.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34250.9" n="1" level="3"> Of inanim. objects, as of the sea: <cit><quote lang="la">pax ipsa tumet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:87" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensim infusa tranquilla per aequora pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:258" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 258</bibl></cit>.—Of a river: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen cum pace delabens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:28" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—Of the countenance: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem vultus habet,</quote> <trans><tr>tranquillity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:858" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 858</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34250.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Peace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquillity</hi> of mind: <cit><quote lang="la">pax animi,</quote> <trans><tr>sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 624</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperantia pacem animis affert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:14:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper in animo sapientis est placidissima pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n34250.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The rest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">peace</hi> of death: <cit><quote lang="la">excepit illum magna et aeterna pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Marc. 19:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Marc. 19, 5</bibl></cit>: so, REQVIESCIT IN PACE, a formula frequently found in later, esp. in Christian epitaphs, borrowed from Jewish grave-stones, on which <foreign />, etc., very frequently occurred; v. the Lat.Hebr. epit. on a Jewess, in Murat. p. 1842, 4, and cf. the inscr. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:page=1674:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 1674, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34250.12" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Peace</hi> in the church, <hi rend="ital">harmony</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quamdiu pax est in populo Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 21, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 13, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n34251" type="main" key="Pax2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pax</orth>, <itype>Pācis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n34251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slave's name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 94</bibl> (889 Ritschl).</sense></entryFree>
paxillus: <entryFree id="n34252" type="main" key="paxillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">paxillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pa/ssalos</foreign>, <sense id="n34252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small stake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a peg.</hi> </sense><sense id="n34252.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 153, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:16:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:3" default="NO">8, 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dodrantales paxilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:22:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 22, 25</bibl> et saep.*—</sense><sense id="n34252.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: novam haeresim novo paxillo suspendisse, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 153, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pe: <entryFree id="n34253" type="main" key="pe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">-pe</orth>, <itype>an enclitic particle with an intensive force</itype> <etym>Sauscr. -pa, -pi, which is similarly used; cf. -que</etym>, as in prope, nempe, quippe; and appearing as p in quispiam, uspiam, etc. (cf. Corss. Ausspr. 2, 846).</entryFree>
peccamen: <entryFree id="n34254" type="main" key="pecca_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peccāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pecco</etym>, <sense id="n34254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sin</hi> (late Lat.): omnium peccaminum venia, Hilar. in Matt. 18, 10; 25, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ap. 979</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cath. 9, 96</bibl>; Hier. in Job, 30.</sense></entryFree>
peccans: <entryFree id="n34255" type="main" key="peccans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peccans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pecco.</entryFree>
peccanter: <entryFree id="n34256" type="main" key="peccanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peccanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pecco, <sense id="n34256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
peccantia: <entryFree id="n34257" type="main" key="peccanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peccantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pecco</etym>, <sense id="n34257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sin</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peccatela: <entryFree id="n34258" type="main" key="pecca_te_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peccātēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sin</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peccatio: <entryFree id="n34259" type="main" key="pecca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peccātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a failing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sin</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peccator: <entryFree id="n34260" type="main" key="pecca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peccātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a transgressor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sinner</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 9, 10</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
peccatorius: <entryFree id="n34261" type="main" key="pecca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peccātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>peccator</etym>, <sense id="n34261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sinful</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carn. Chr. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
peccatrix: <entryFree id="n34262" type="main" key="pecca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peccātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female sinner</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 28, 127</bibl>; <cb n="PECO" /> Hier. adv. Joann. Jerosol. n. 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 7, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34262.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">sinning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sinful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatrix anima, Prud. Cath. prooem. 35: gens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Macc. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peccatum: <entryFree id="n34263" type="main" key="pecca_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peccātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pecco</etym>, <sense id="n34263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">error</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mistake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transgression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sin</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">delictum, culpa): pro peccatis supplicium sufferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata remordent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 827</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte facta sola in bonis actionibus ponens, prave, id est peccata, in malis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: ut peccatum est, patriam prodere, parentes violare, fana depeculari, quae sunt in effectu; <cit><quote lang="la">sic timere, sic maerere, sic in libidine esse, peccatum est, etiam sine effectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpa ac peccatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo vitiorum peccatorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:17:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 17, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo illi crimine peccatoque perierunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:30:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 30, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinum peccatorumque licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confiteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:27:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 27, 125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis verbis tria magna peccata,</quote> <trans><tr>blunders</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:20:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in peccata incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:15:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luere peccata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccati conscius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatis poenas aequas irrogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatis veniam commodare, Tac Agr. 19: abstinere peccatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 22, 2</bibl></cit>. Here, too, doubtless belongs: nam eā aetate jam sum, ut non siet peccato mi ignosci aequom <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34263.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n34263.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Guilt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non venissem peccatum non haberent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 15, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognatio pec-cati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n34263.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The punishment of sin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatum vestrum apprehendet vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:32:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 32, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse peccata multorum tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:53:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 53, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
peccatus: <entryFree id="n34264" type="main" key="pecca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">peccātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n34264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a failing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trespass</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in manifesto peccatu teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 191</bibl></cit>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:17 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 17 sq.</bibl> (al. peccato).</sense></entryFree>
